name: (02)room
summary: Close to the T(train/subway) station, Downtown, MIT, Harvard, Tufts University. Quiet and safe neighborhood. One private bedroom with lock on the door. Other space like kitchen, bathroom, living room are shared with others. Transportation: 8 mins walking to Sullivan Square train station on orange line.  10-15 mins train to Downtown/South Station. 5-10 mins to Harvard, MIT by car.
space: Parking condition: Street parking(Let me know first if you have a car) - Comfortable bed, bed sets - Towels - Shampoo, body wash - Cooking equipments - High Speed Internet WiFi  - Picking up service from Logan airport(Ask about it, depends on time). - There is no washer and dryer in the apartment. But a laundromat is only 1-2 blocks away.

notes: Boston is the city that has lots of historical buildings and old houses. My house is one of them. It's an old house so there would have some old part/small damaged part, but it is clean and good to use. We hired professional housekeeper to do the cleaning. If you have concern, please contact host first. Large oven under stove is forbid to use.
house_rules: 1. No party, no event, no loud music are allowed in our apartment.  2. Smoking and drug using are strictly prohibited inside the apartment, in apartment hallway and near the front entrance stairs. 3. Quiet time: 10pm ~ 8am. Do not disturb neighbors.  4. No extra person stay in the apartment except those listed in your group when you placed booking. 5. Please don't throw trash or trash bags outside the house, not even in the bin. Contact me to collect trash bags. There're special rule on street. 6. Please wash your used dishes, glasses, pots and pans immediately after you use. 7. Please don't put your private stuff everywhere in shared space and blocks others' use. 8. Please clean hair in shower space after you use. Clean hair from bathroom strainer(hair blocks, where water outflow inside tub). We usually come and clean everyday, but we can't be there 24 hours. Please try to keep clean! Thank you!
amenities: {Wifi,"Air conditioning",Kitchen,Heating,"Smoke detector",Essentials,Shampoo,"Lock on bedroom door","Hair dryer","Laptop friendly workspace"}
host_about: Undergraduate student in Umass Boston. I came from Chongqing, China. Would like to welcome friendly guests from all around the world.

name: Harvard Sq Cambridge 2 Bdrm w/ Deck & Parking
summary: A sun drenched corner-unit townhouse in a fabulous location - an easy walk to both Harvard and Central Squares. It is a spacious 2 bedroom place with an open floor plan, large living room, pull out couch, TV with premium cable, high speed internet, a large newly renovated eat-in kitchen. The unit sleeps 6. Off-street Parking included.  Just a short walk to the red-line, and all the best restaurants, nightlife, cafes, green spaces & shops. MIT and Kendall are easily accessible.
space: Newly renovated kitchen, great open floor plan with lots of brick and wood accents.  Main bedroom includes walk in closet and large built in corner desk unit - great working space.  Private 2nd floor deck off the living room with gas grill, plants, and patio furniture.  Shared front garden area with 2nd gas grill and brick patio and furniture.
description: A sun drenched corner-unit townhouse in a fabulous location - an easy walk to both Harvard and Central Squares. It is a spacious 2 bedroom place with an open floor plan, large living room, pull out couch, TV with premium cable, high speed internet, a large newly renovated eat-in kitchen. The unit sleeps 6. Off-street Parking included.  Just a short walk to the red-line, and all the best restaurants, nightlife, cafes, green spaces & shops. MIT and Kendall are easily accessible. Newly renovated kitchen, great open floor plan with lots of brick and wood accents.  Main bedroom includes walk in closet and large built in corner desk unit - great working space.  Private 2nd floor deck off the living room with gas grill, plants, and patio furniture.  Shared front garden area with 2nd gas grill and brick patio and furniture. Guests have private access to large townhouse with front garden, brick patio, gas grill, private deck, off-street parking, fully equipped eat-in kitchen, and shared laundry
neighborhood_overview: The townhouse is located directly between Harvard Square and Central Square and 1 block from the Charles River with great running and biking trails. Whole Foods and Rite Aid Pharmacy are a 5 minute walk from the front door. Harvard Square offers museums, shops, cafes, music halls, book stores, and more and Central has some of the best restaurants in Boston (we love the Little Donkey and Thelonious Monkfish!)
notes: Private off-street parking included in rental. Easy access to Harvard Business School, MIT, Kendall Square, and all Cambridge has to offer
transit: Red Line subway stops are an easy walk with lots of bus stops within 1 block.  If you have access to a car the home is conveniently located just off I-90, storrow drive, memorial drive, and a short distance to 93.
access: Guests have private access to large townhouse with front garden, brick patio, gas grill, private deck, off-street parking, fully equipped eat-in kitchen, and shared laundry unit in basement.
interaction: The keys will be available in a lock box (you will receive the code prior to check in) so you can check in anytime after 3 pm on the day of your reservation.  We're local and happy to offer any tips to explore Cambridge and surrounding areas!

name: Sunny Bedroom in Cambridgeport
summary: Bedroom with one queen bed OR two single beds, within a shared apartment. We are on a quiet street filled with families, within walking distance of Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, MIT, Harvard, and Central Square.
space: The space is shared and housemates will be in and out of the house throughout the day, and often work together in the shared common areas.
description: Bedroom with one queen bed OR two single beds, within a shared apartment. We are on a quiet street filled with families, within walking distance of Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, MIT, Harvard, and Central Square. The space is shared and housemates will be in and out of the house throughout the day, and often work together in the shared common areas. You will have access to a shared bathroom, the kitchen, living areas, and front/back porch.  The fridge and freezer are available to you for storing food, just remember to label your things with your name. We live in the apartment and will be around! The area is within walking distance of central Cambridge. Commonwealth Ave in Boston is a short walk across the river. Fenway and downtown Boston are nearby. The closest grocery store is Trader Joe's around the corner, which has a Starbucks next to it. There is a Blue Bike station at the Trader Joe's a block away.  The closest T stations are the Red line in Central Square and the Green line at BU o
neighborhood_overview: The area is within walking distance of central Cambridge. Commonwealth Ave in Boston is a short walk across the river. Fenway and downtown Boston are nearby. The closest grocery store is Trader Joe's around the corner, which has a Starbucks next to it.
transit: There is a Blue Bike station at the Trader Joe's a block away.  The closest T stations are the Red line in Central Square and the Green line at BU on Comm Ave. A city bus route is a block away. Ride sharing services are generally fast and inexpensive.
access: You will have access to a shared bathroom, the kitchen, living areas, and front/back porch.  The fridge and freezer are available to you for storing food, just remember to label your things with your name.

host_about: I live and work in Cambridge, Massachusetts, next to Boston. I own and manage a solar engineering company called Zapotec Energy where we design and assist in the installation of solar photovoltaic systems for commercial and institutional clients. I have lived in Bolivia, Haiti, Mexico and Spain, and enjoy traveling to many parts of the U.S. and the world.

name: Two-floor Apartment in Newton Corner April-July 10
summary: We are super hosts, (please see other reviews), renting out our home for three + months. The two-floor apartment is on the 2nd & 3rd floors in a Victorian, located on a busy street with buses (local and express) to downtown Boston (Federal St. & Copley Square) & Kenmore Square. The space is perfect for two couples or two professionals with plenty of privacy for each. Cable, wi-fi, laundry, parking for two cars, and all amenities included. Please contact us if interested in the full three months!
space: 1st floor: entry way and stairs. 2nd floor: eat-in kitchen with laundry, dishwasher, microwave, etc., deck, bathroom with tub, living room w/cable tv, spacious bedroom with queen size bed & sitting area and piano., second entryway and back stairs. 3rd floor: small bedroom with double futon, large sitting/reading/tv room with cable, high ceilings,7 skylights, two office nooks & bathroom with full tub.  Parking for 2 cars.

name: Basic, Convenient, private room 3 min to Cambridge
summary: This is maybe the most convenient place, affordable and very close to public transportation in 15 min by bus to Boston Downtown! Amazing neighborhood, close to restaurants, shops, big malls and now the biggest casino in MA. The famous casino of Boston is like 2 min walk from the house. It's a basic room with a queen bed. It's practical and not fancy. So make sure you bring any extra things you might need. I hope you will enjoy your stay, and please message me for any questions.
space: It's a very basic space. Just a comfy bed and large room with a closet. It's truly practical and convenient. This is place for people who travels on budget. If you are too fancy, this place might not be for you.
description: This is maybe the most convenient place, affordable and very close to public transportation in 15 min by bus to Boston Downtown! It's practical and not fancy. So make sure you bring any extra things you might need. I hope you will enjoy your stay, and please message me for any questions. It's a very basic space. You will be able to use all the common rooms in the house I will pass by when i am around to say hello There is a lot to do!  While the space directly around the house feels like a construction site due to the casino, if you walk for 10 min you will find the Assembly row where there are plenty of coffee
neighborhood_overview: There is a lot to do!  While the space directly around the house feels like a construction site due to the casino, if you walk for 10 min you will find the Assembly row where there are plenty of coffee shops, restaurants and a cinema movie theater.
notes: Bedroom doors have no locks, but it is very safe, and parking is available on a first come first served basis.
transit: You can use Uber, or get by public transportation. It is just 7 min from the airport!
access: You will be able to use all the common rooms in the house
interaction: I will pass by when i am around to say hello
house_rules: We do have a flexible check in but this means that guests can leave their luggages in the common area while waiting for the previous guest to check out (usually at 9 am) and the cleaning team to clean the room. We want to make it so smooth for the guests, and we would appreciate your cooperation on informing us about your schedule, and we will do our duty and informing you when the room is ready which should be usually between (12 pm - 6 pm)
amenities: {TV,Internet,Wifi,Kitchen,"Free parking on premises","Buzzer/wireless intercom",Heating,Washer,Dryer,"Smoke detector","Carbon monoxide detector","Fire extinguisher",Essentials,Shampoo,Hangers,"Laptop friendly workspace","Self check-in",Lockbox,"Hot water","Bed linens","Extra pillows and blankets",Microwave,"Coffee maker",Refrigerator,"Dishes and silverware","Cooking basics",Oven,Stove,"Luggage dropoff allowed","Long term stays allowed"}
host_about:
We are a group of friends fortunate to work/study full time between great cities such as Miami, Boston, New York, Providence, Berkshires, Moscow, Baku, & Beirut. We have full time careers and yes we live out of a suitcase. Airbnb is a side gig. Some places are very basic, others are of great value. Our places are for people traveling on a budget. We have great cohosts & long term tenants that will take care of you in case we are not available. We love to travel, and connect with people. We have a passion for physics, coding, policies and rare diseases. This account is managed by an AI called Kiki.

Life Moto: 
“We are all travelers in this world. From the sweet grass to the packing house, birth till death, we travel between the eternities.”

name: 1Br apartment close to Harvard Square
summary: This is a well-located apartment, by the river and close to Harvard Square. The place is warm (heating permanently on), has comfortable spaces, good light, and a fully equipped kitchen. It can host up to 4 people, has one bathroom fully restored and a working desk.
space: The apartment is nicely decorated, has all you may need for your stay (high speed wifi, High-end appliances in the kitchen, printer, desk, etc). It has natural light both in the bedroom and in the living room. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The kitchen and bathroom are modernly equipped. You will definetly feel at home!

name: Beautiful private basement apartment in Somerville
summary: We look forward to welcoming you to our home!  This is a basement apartment with a private keyless entrance.  You will have complete privacy from the main house.  This apartment has a large living room, full bath, and bedroom. Please note there is no kitchen (however, there is a mini fridge and microwave).  There is also one parking spot for guests with a vehicle. This apartment uses keyless entry so check-in is super easy and does not require meeting us at a specific time.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston that is home to a diverse group of family and professionals. This prime residential location is just a short subway ride from downtown Boston. With the vibrant areas around MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood, as well as the exciting new Cambridge Crossing area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why the Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.
notes: This Blueground apartment is available for stays of a month, a year, or even more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy. During your stay, guests have access to our Client Experience team around the clock through the Blueground App. Request cleaning and laundry, request maintenance repairs and view our neighbourhood recommendations at the click of a button.

In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - Same day check-ins are only guaranteed if booking is made before 4 pm - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions, along with related fees. Guests should notify us of any pets prior to check-in (failing to do so will incur a penalty) - Relevant communication will be sent in case of a viewing request for the apartment during your stay - Please contact us for details

host_about:
Blueground is changing the way the world experiences furnished living.

We take perfectly located apartments and turn them into beautifully-designed and thoughtfully-equipped homes available for stays of 30 days or longer. 

Each Blueground property comes with modern furniture, premium linens, high-speed WiFi, and everything else you need to get up and running from day one.

All backed by our dedicated, on-the-ground support team, Blueground makes finding a new place to call home frictionless. Show up and start living with Blueground today.

Founded in 2013, Blueground is currently present in nine cities around the world and has a portfolio of more than 1500 premium properties... and growing.

interaction: We are always available as a concierge for advice and assistance to make your Boston Experience the best, both inside the house and in advising you of the most fascinating destinations in this amazing city. house_rules: Dear guest please follow the house rules, it is important for us to keep our house clean and comfortable for every one. 1- no shoes at home ( feel free to bring ur own sleeper)  2- no smoking at home or at the garden  3- no extra electric Heaters or other things inside the room with out host permission. 4- please give us call one hour before reaching to our place, call or message both is fine. It is important for us as host to know the exactly arrival time of our guests. 5- no extra guest over night with out host permission. 6- please wash your dishes and clean the stove after using the kitchen, it is very import for us to respect all the guests at home  7- do not leave the hair inside the bathroom, shower, bathtub, leave the rest room and bathroom clean after use  8- you will have to share bathrooms with other guests, if you are not comfortable sharing the bathrooms with others please DO NOT BOOK this room.  9- regardless of the length of your stay, for logistics reasons, we are only

name: Private Room in East Somerville STEPS from Subway!
summary: Private room in a brand new apartment in the up and coming neighborhood of East Somerville. We are literally steps from the subway station which you can take and get to downtown Boston in 10 mins. We are also a 10 min walk from Assembly Row, the newly developed commercial area in Somerville will a plethora of outlets and restaurants. There is also a deck you can access from the apartment.
space: This room has a private bathroom and two individual work spaces.  Guests are free to use the living room and kitchen will be shared with other guests. The beds are bunked and will sleep 2 people. The room is located next to a highway and may not be great for light sleepers.

name: Comfortable and safe room
summary: Do you wish to stay in a comfy&economic private room near Cambridge? It’s historical and convenient location to stay in the house. You could find small market, restaurants, bars, grocery store, laundry store nearby the house in a few blocks away. It’s quiet and safe neighborhood.
space: House location is close to the T(train/subway) station “Sullivan Suqare” on orange line around 10 mins walking distance. It’s close to Downtown, MIT, Harvard, Tufts University. Extra service: We provide picking up service from Logan airport(Ask about it, depends on time. It charges extra service fee).

To Harvard, MIT:  - 5-10 mins by car.  - or
notes: Boston is the city that has lots of historical buildings and old houses. My house is one of them. It's an old house so there would have some old part/small damaged part, but it is clean and good to use. We hired professional housekeeper to do the cleaning. If you have concern, please contact host first.
transit: To Sullivan Square T station on orange line:  - 10 mins walking. To Downtown/South Station:  - 10-15 mins by T. To Harvard, MIT:  - 5-10 mins by car.  - or 15 mins by public transportation. The time shows above is average approximant time. It might have some changes depends on T line management or traffic impact. Parking situation: Street parking. We don’t provide guarantee parking space since it’s street parking. We have limited parking permits for guests use. It’s free to use parking permit if we have available one but guest need to contact host to use it and shall return it back before check out. Otherwise, there will be penalty fee charges($100).

name: Private room  5 min to MIT/Cambridge/harvard
summary: From The Esplanade that edges the Charles River to the Brownstones that line its refined streets. This neighborhood ages with grace.  This is a 2nd floor of an old typical boston building. There are 3 private bedrooms in different sizes and one bathroom on each level. Shared areas are a living room, kitchen,  and 2 bathrooms. 1 min walk to Encore Casino 5 min uber to MIT/Harvard/Somerville
space: This place is not for everyone. This is not a hotel.  There is no breakfast. This is a modest & cozy place in a prime location in the heart of Boston. You cannot beat this location. We worked extremely hard to secure this location. It is not fancy. it's an old building but it has its charm. It only has the bare necessities. People love it because it is practical and functional. Upon booking, you will get the self check in instructions.  You will be asked if you understand every step to find your room. Your room is equipped with a large bed, a desk, and desk lamp. You will be sharing the common areas (living room, kitchen and bathrooms) with other guests just like you. Your room will have fresh sheets, & a towel. The common areas are cleaned frequently but we cannot control what other guests do in regards to cleanliness, so please set expectations right. However we take things seriously and do our best to keep the common areas comfortable to everyone and we encourage you to message us i

neighborhood_overview: Boston's diverse mix of residents converge on Newbury Street, one of the city's favorite destinations for boutique shopping, casual people-watching, and urban promenading.  On Newbury Street, stores occupy the bottom-floors of the neighborhood's iconic Brownstones. When you're looking for familiar indoor shopping, take a brief walk to The Prudential Center. This cleanly-styled mall boasts over 75 high-end retailers. Saks Fifth Avenue, Lord & Taylor, Lacoste, Club Monaco, Sephora? Whether lunching, brunching, or evening snacking, Back Bay's mix of cafes, steakhouses, tapas bars, and trendy lounges leave patrons with a good taste in their mouths.
notes: Please note that we put a lot of effort and sweat in running this airbnb, and while this is a great gig, we would like you to have an unforgettable experience.
transit: Our apartment is located 1 min walk from Encore Casino in Everett!
access: As guests you have access to the kitchen where we ask you to use it to do light meals only. You have access to the living room and bathrooms.  While our rules of the house are pretty clear regarding respect and cleanliness, we ask you to tell us as soon as something bothers you in the common area. Sometimes we cannot control what other guests do in the sharing areas, but we will do our best to follow up on a timely manner.
interaction: Akiki the primary hosts might come by from time to time to check on guests, however the major interaction will be with the cohost who will be there to answer your messages and make sure your experience is excellent.
house_rules: - 1. Quiet hours in the shared areas are from 10 pm to 7 am - 2. No shoes in the house - 3. Communication of arrival time is a must, and double confirming with the host through the airbnb messaging platform about the readiness of your room is a MUST. Please any show ups to the appartment that is not scheduled will be treated as a violation. - 4. Check out is at 9 am. This is important because the cleaning team needs to come to fix the room for the next guest. Kindly respect that.  - 5. There are extra fees with additional non booked guests.  - 6. Leave the keys of the (self check in process) in the master lock and under the mat. This is EXTREMELY important, please. -7. We do have a flexible check in but this means that guests can leave their luggages in the common area while waiting for the previous guest to check out (usually at 9 am) and the cleaning team to clean the room. We want to make it so smooth for the guests, and we would appreciate your cooperation on informing us about you

host_about:
We are a group of friends fortunate to work/study full time between great cities such as Miami, Boston, New York, Providence, Berkshires, Moscow, Baku, & Beirut. We have full time careers and yes we live out of a suitcase. Airbnb is a side gig. Some places are very basic, others are of great value. Our places are for people traveling on a budget. We have great cohosts & long term tenants that will take care of you in case we are not available. We love to travel, and connect with people. We have a passion for physics, coding, policies and rare diseases. This account is managed by an AI called Kiki.

Life Moto: 
“We are all travelers in this world. From the sweet grass to the packing house, birth till death, we travel between the eternities.”

name: Spacious bedroom/train B1
summary: Comfortable bed in a newly renovated spacious basement room in Somerville, just a quick 10 minutes walk to Sullivan Station (2 minutes bus) on the orange line and a short 13 minutes train ride to Downtown Boston. Driving takes only 10 minutes. Free Back yard parking. You can either stay here for a night or a few months!
space: Newly renovated town house with fully stocked kitchen. The living room has a 60 in TV with full cable for your entertainment.
description: Comfortable bed in a newly renovated spacious basement room in Somerville, just a quick 10 minutes walk to Sullivan Station (2 minutes bus) on the orange line and a short 13 minutes train ride to Downtown Boston. Driving takes only 10 minutes. Free Back yard parking. You can either stay here for a night or a few months! Newly renovated town house with fully stocked kitchen. The living room has a 60 in TV with full cable for your entertainment. Everything in the kitchen and living room as well as full bath on the second floor and half bathroom on the first floor. Free laundry in the basement. I can show you around after work hours if you'd like. One of the housemates grew up in Boston so she'll be a great guide as well! Conveniently located. Close to public transportation (both the train and bus) 6 minutes walk to Stop and shop. Steps away from one of the best french restaurant! Walkable to Assembly Row, a vibrant shopping outlet and restaurants. From the airport: Public Transportation:
neighborhood_overview: Conveniently located. Close to public transportation (both the train and bus) 6 minutes walk to Stop and shop. Steps away from one of the best french restaurant! Walkable to Assembly Row, a vibrant shopping outlet and restaurants.
transit: From the airport: Public Transportation: Take the silver line to South Station, then take the northbound Red line train to Downtown Crossing (1 Stop) then switch over to the orange line and take the Oak Grove train to Sullivan Square (5 stops). Then either take a bus (89) or walk 10 minutes to the house. It's a pretty easy walk - just straight down Broadway street. - Total time: 45 minutes Driving: It's a 16 minutes drive down MA-1A S. Exploring the city - The train/bus will take you everywhere you need to go! Driving is pretty easy as well!
access: Everything in the kitchen and living room as well as full bath on the second floor and half bathroom on the first floor. Free laundry in the basement.
interaction: I can show you around after work hours if you'd like. One of the housemates grew up in Boston so she'll be a great guide as well!

Shared areas are a living room, kitchen,  and 2 bathrooms. 1 min walk to Encore Casino 5 min uber to MIT/Harvard/Somerville This place is not for everyone. This is not a hotel.  There is no breakfast. This is a modest & cozy place in a prime location in the heart of Boston. You cannot beat this location. We worked extremely hard to secure this location. It is not fancy. it's an old building but it has its charm. It only has the bare necessities. People love it because it is practical and functional. Upon booking, you will get the self check in instructions.  You will be asked if you understand every step to find your room. Your room is equipped with a large bed, a desk, and desk lamp. You will be sharing the common areas
neighborhood_overview: Boston's diverse mix of residents converge on Newbury Street, one of the city's favorite destinations for boutique shopping, casual people-watching, and urban promenading.  On Newbury Street, stores occupy the bottom-floors of the neighborhood's iconic Brownstones. When you're looking for familiar indoor shopping, take a brief walk to The Prudential Center. This cleanly-styled mall boasts over 75 high-end retailers. Saks Fifth Avenue, Lord & Taylor, Lacoste, Club Monaco, Sephora? Whether lunching, brunching, or evening snacking, Back Bay's mix of cafes, steakhouses, tapas bars, and trendy lounges leave patrons with a good taste in their mouths.
notes: Please note that we put a lot of effort and sweat in running this airbnb, and while this is a great gig, we would like you to have an unforgettable experience.
transit: Our apartment is located 1 min walk from Encore Casino in Everett!
access: As guests you have access to the kitchen where we ask you to use it to do light meals only. You have access to the living room and bathrooms.  While our rules of the house are pretty clear regarding respect and cleanliness, we ask you to tell us as soon as something bothers you in the common area. Sometimes we cannot control what other guests do in the sharing areas, but we will do our best to follow up on a timely manner.
interaction: Akiki the primary hosts might come by from time to time to check on guests, however the major interaction will be with the cohost who will be there to answer your messages and make sure your experience is excellent.
house_rules: - 1. Quiet hours in the shared areas are from 10 pm to 7 am - 2. No shoes in the house - 3. Communication of arrival time is a must, and double confirming with the host through the airbnb messaging platform about the readiness of your room is a MUST. Please any show ups to the appartment that is not scheduled will be treated as a violation. - 4. Check out is at 9 am. This is important because the cleaning team needs to come to fix the room for the next guest. Kindly respect that.  - 5. There are extra fees with additional non booked guests.  - 6. Leave the keys of the (self check in process) in the master lock and under the mat. This is EXTREMELY important, please. -7. We do have a flexible check in but this means that guests can leave their luggages in the common area while waiting for the previous guest to check out (usually at 9 am) and the cleaning team to clean the room. We want to make it so smooth for the guests, and we would appreciate your cooperation on informing us about you
amenities: {Wifi,Kitchen,"Free parking on premises","Paid parking off premises",Heating,Washer,Dryer,"Smoke detector","Carbon monoxide detector",Essentials,Hangers,"Laptop friendly workspace","Self check-in",Lockbox,"Hot water","Bed linens","Extra pillows and blankets",Microwave,"Coffee maker",Refrigerator,"Dishes and silverware","Cooking basics",Stove,"Luggage dropoff allowed","Long term stays allowed"}
host_about:
We are a group of friends fortunate to work/study full time between great cities such as Miami, Boston, New York, Providence, Berkshires, Moscow, Baku, & Beirut. We have full time careers and yes we live out of a suitcase. Airbnb is a side gig. Some places are very basic, others are of great value. Our places are for people traveling on a budget. We have great cohosts & long term tenants that will take care of you in case we are not available. We love to travel, and connect with people. We have a passion for physics, coding, policies and rare diseases. This account is managed by an AI called Kiki.

Life Moto: 
“We are all travelers in this world. From the sweet grass to the packing house, birth till death, we travel between the eternities.”

space: The unit has a full kitchen, full bath, large sofa, a queen-sized bed, and a twin bed.  Beautiful neighborhood with Charles river sparkling nearby. Located near Harvard campus. Redline subway station only 10 min away to go see downtown Boston!

name: Cozy Room in East Somerville STEPS from Subway!
summary: Private room in a brand new apartment in the up and coming neighborhood of East Somerville. We are literally steps from the subway station which you can take and get to downtown Boston in 10 mins. We are also a 10 min walk from Assembly Row, the newly developed commercial area in Somerville will a plethora of outlets and restaurants. There is also a deck you can access from the apartment.
space: This is a private room and has two individual work spaces. Guests are free to use the living room and kitchen will be shared with other guests. The beds are bunked and will sleep 2 people. The room is located next to a highway and may not be great for light sleepers.

name: Somerville comfort room
summary: Close to the T(train/subway) station, Downtown, MIT, Harvard, Tufts University. Quiet and safe neighborhood. One private bedroom with lock on the door. Other space like kitchen, bathroom, living room are shared with others. Transportation: 8 mins walking to Sullivan Square train station on orange line.  10-15 mins train to Downtown/South Station. 5-10 mins to Harvard, MIT by car.
space: Parking condition: Street parking. Not guaranteed parking space.(Let me know first if you have a car) - Comfortable bed, bed sets - Towels - Shampoo, body wash - Cooking equipment - High Speed Internet WiFi  - Picking up service from Logan airport(Ask about it, depends on time). - There is no washer and dryer in the apartment. But a laundromat is only 1-2 blocks away.

notes: Boston is the city that has lots of historical buildings and old houses. My house is one of them. It's an old house so there would have some old part/small damaged part, but it is clean and good to use. We hired professional housekeeper to do the cleaning. If you have concern, please contact host first. Large oven under stove is forbid to use.
house_rules: Thanks for booking and all the information about your group and your trip. Here is your check-in/checkout information: 1. Property Address: 151 Perkins St, Somerville, MA (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) 2. Your Check-In time will be: 2:00pm or later Normally, the previous guest will check out before 11:00 am, then our housekeeper will need a few hours to clean the apartment.  For special arrangement like early check in or drop luggage, you must contact us at least one day before your check-in to verify if we can arrange early check-in/drop luggage for you. 3. Your Check-out time will be: 11:00am Our apartments are usually booked back to back, and our housekeeper needs enough time to thoroughly clean up the apartment. Therefore the check out time is firm. However, if you need to leave your luggage, you must contact us at least one day earlier to verify the arrangement. 4. How to get the keys (self check-in):  You can self check in without meeting anyone.  Address: 151 Perkins StSomervil

name: Private spacious room
summary: A spacious room located in a quiet, safe, and convenient neighborhood. 5 min walking to Orange Line subway with 2 stops to North Station and 10 minutes to Downtown Boston. Also about 10 minutes to Harvard and MIT by bus. Walking distance to Target and restaurants/convenience stores.

house_rules: Dear guest please follow the house rules, it is important for us to keep our house clean and comfortable for every one. 1- no shoes at home ( feel free to bring ur own sleeper)  2- no smoking at home or at the garden  3- no extra electric Heaters or other things inside the room with out host permission. 4- please give us call one hour before reaching to our place, call or message both is fine. name: Private and large room walking to Encore Casino!
summary: From The Esplanade that edges the Charles River to the Brownstones that line its refined streets. This neighborhood ages with grace.  This is a 2nd floor of an old typical boston building. There are 3 private bedrooms in different sizes and one bathroom on each level. Shared areas are a living room, kitchen,  and 2 bathrooms. 1 min walk to Encore Casino 5 min uber to MIT/Harvard/Somerville
space: This place is not for everyone. This is not a hotel.  There is no breakfast. This is a modest & cozy place in a prime location in the heart of Boston. You cannot beat this location. We worked extremely hard to secure this location. It is not fancy. it's an old building but it has its charm. It only has the bare necessities. People love it because it is practical and functional. Upon booking, you will get the self check in instructions.  You will be asked if you understand every step to find your room. Your room is equipped with a large bed, a desk, and desk lamp. You will be sharing the common areas (living room, kitchen and bathrooms) with other guests just like you. Your room will have fresh sheets, & a towel. The common areas are cleaned frequently but we cannot control what other guests do in regards to cleanliness, so please set expectations right. However we take things seriously and do our best to keep the common areas comfortable to everyone and we encourage you to message us i

This is a 2nd floor of an old typical boston building. There are 3 private bedrooms in different sizes and one bathroom on each level. neighborhood_overview: Boston's diverse mix of residents converge on Newbury Street, one of the city's favorite destinations for boutique shopping, casual people-watching, and urban promenading.  On Newbury Street, stores occupy the bottom-floors of the neighborhood's iconic Brownstones. When you're looking for familiar indoor shopping, take a brief walk to The Prudential Center. This cleanly-styled mall boasts over 75 high-end retailers. Saks Fifth Avenue, Lord & Taylor, Lacoste, Club Monaco, Sephora? Whether lunching, brunching, or evening snacking, Back Bay's mix of cafes, steakhouses, tapas bars, and trendy lounges leave patrons with a good taste in their mouths.
notes: Please note that we put a lot of effort and sweat in running this airbnb, and while this is a great gig, we would like you to have an unforgettable experience.
transit: Our apartment is located 1 min walk from Encore Casino in Everett!
access: As guests you have access to the kitchen where we ask you to use it to do light meals only. You have access to the living room and bathrooms.  While our rules of the house are pretty clear regarding respect and cleanliness, we ask you to tell us as soon as something bothers you in the common area. Sometimes we cannot control what other guests do in the sharing areas, but we will do our best to follow up on a timely manner.
interaction: The major interaction will be with the cohost who will be there to answer your messages and make sure your experience is excellent.
house_rules: - 1. Quiet hours in the shared areas are from 10 pm to 7 am - 2. No shoes in the house - 3. Communication of arrival time is a must, and double confirming with the host through the airbnb messaging platform about the readiness of your room is a MUST. Please any show ups to the appartment that is not scheduled will be treated as a violation. - 4. Check out is at 9 am. This is important because the cleaning team needs to come to fix the room for the next guest. Kindly respect that.  - 5. There are extra fees with additional non booked guests.  - 6. Leave the keys of the (self check in process) in the master lock and under the mat. This is EXTREMELY important, please. -7. We do have a flexible check in but this means that guests can leave their luggages in the common area while waiting for the previous guest to check out (usually at 9 am) and the cleaning team to clean the room. We want to make it so smooth for the guests, and we would appreciate your cooperation on informing us about you

name: East Cambridge 1BR w/ W/D near the Espanade by Blueground
summary: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this exquisite East Cambridge furnished one-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and sophisticated living room. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Boston has to offer! (#BOS100)
space: Thoughtfully designed with bespoke finishes, modern furnishings, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you’ll enjoy that “I’m home” feeling with this Blueground apartment. Whether you’re lounging in your lovely living room streaming the latest and greatest entertainment on the smart TV or premium wireless speaker, or getting some well-earned rest on the superior quality mattress with luxury linens, you’ll fall in love with everything this East Cambridge apartment has to offer.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry. Amenities Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:    - Doorman - Pet Friendly - Outdoor Private Pool - Gym - Elevator

This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry. Amenities Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:    - Doorman - Pet Friendly - Outdoor Private Pool - Gym - Elevator The entire apartment is yours
neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live.  With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - Building amenities may have an extra cost - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - Same day check-ins are only guaranteed if booking is made before 4 pm - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions, along with related fees. Guests should notify us of any pets prior to check-in (failing to do so will incur a penalty) - Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance - Please contact us for details

host_about:
Blueground is changing the way the world experiences furnished living.

We take perfectly located apartments and turn them into beautifully-designed and thoughtfully-equipped homes available for stays of 30 days or longer. 

Each Blueground property comes with modern furniture, premium linens, high-speed WiFi, and everything else you need to get up and running from day one.

All backed by our dedicated, on-the-ground support team, Blueground makes finding a new place to call home frictionless. Show up and start living with Blueground today.

Founded in 2013, Blueground is currently present in nine cities around the world and has a portfolio of more than 1500 premium properties... and growing.

name: Family friendly, near Central Sq & Charles River
summary: Our sunlit, open concept condo is walking distance to Central Square. We have 2 bedrooms and 1.5 bathrooms, and can sleep a family of 4. One bedroom has a queen bed, and the second bedroom has a full size bunk over bunk. We are walking distance to Central Sq, Harvard Sq & MIT, as well as to the Red Line & MBTA bus. We are close to music, restaurants, and coffeeshops, and a quick walk to the Charles River. Whole Foods is a stone's throw away and Trader Joe's is a short walk away.
space: We live in a great neighborhood, with a number of parks nearby, and a 7 minute walk to Central Square, where you have access to a number of wonderful restaurants, fun coffee shops, and stores. We are a 15 minute walk to Harvard Square and Kendall Square, where you are in the hub of academics, history, culture, science and biotech. Our condo is on the second unit. We are lucky to be close to the Charles River, and Whole Foods and Trader Joe's are both very accessible.   Bathroom is stocked with towels, soap, shampoo/conditioner, and hair dryer. Kitchen includes microwave, dishwasher, refrigerator, and coffeemaker. Kitchen includes basic utensils, cookware and glasses/dishes. We will provide one guest permit for on street parking in our neighborhood zone. Guests are able to check-in at 3:00 pm on the date of arrival. Check-out is no later than 11:00 am on date of check out. We have a guest pass to the Atlantis Sports Club (at the Hyatt hotel). Amenities include cardio machines, small wei

neighborhood_overview: *There are several coffeeshops in the neighborhood (Flour, Cafe Nero, Darwins, Whole Foods, Starbucks, and Dunkin).  *There are many delicious restaurants in the Central Sq, Harvard Sq, and Kendall Sq area. *We do not lack parks in the neighborhood, all are a 2 minute walk away.  *A trip to Whole Foods for last minute snacks and treats.
notes: No smoking Not suitable for pets No parties or events Check in is anytime after 3PM Check out is at 11AM
transit: *The MBTA bus and red line are accessible. *Crossing the Mass Ave bridge will bring you over to Boston (also accessible by bus and train). *Proximity to the Charles River for a stroll or a run.
access: *You have access to the second floor unit, including the front and back decks. After you book, I'll send an email with all sorts of information about how to get to the building, how to reach me, and a lot of recommendations for fun things to do while you're here. *Parking - A guest parking permit is available for you to use only in our neighborhood.  Please note that street parking may be difficult at times (depending on the month), and we highly recommend exploring by foot.

name: Bright corner room in Central Square -Harvard, MIT
summary: Welcome! This is a bright corner room in a newly renovated apartment, located in the heart of Cambridge by Central Square.  Nearby locations: - 5 min walk to parks by the Charles river  - 10 min walk to Central Square (restaurants, bars, subway station)  - 10-15 min walk to Harvard Business School, Harvard University, and MIT - 20 min subway ride to Downtown Boston
space: You are welcome to use the spacious kithen and living room. There is a half bathroom off the living room (1st floor) and a full bathroom down the hallway from this room (2nd floor). Please note that the full bathroom is shared with one other person.

Nearby locations: - 5 min walk to parks by the Charles river  - 10 min walk to Central Square (restaurants, bars, subway station)  - 10-15 min walk to Harvard Business School, Harvard University, and MIT - 20 min subway ride to Downtown Boston You are welcome to use the spacious kithen and living room. amenities: {TV,Wifi,"Air conditioning",Kitchen,Washer,Dryer,Essentials,Shampoo,Iron,"Laptop friendly workspace","Private living room"}
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Hello! I am a young professional works in New York and grew up in Toronto. As a young professional in consulting and travel enthusiast who backpacked across Europe using Airbnb, I decided to try out opening up my room to other travelers while I am away.

I love my life in the city, primarily due to my close group of caring, fun, and undeniably nerdy friends. They describe me as bubbly, friendly, and laid back. Similar to Carrie's shoe shopping addiction in Sex in the City, I have difficulty leaving bookstands without buying a discounted book. 

I love spending my free time reading, backpacking, watching Netflix, playing board games, eating my way around the city, and watching the occasional Broadway show. Somewhat outdoorsy and a little bit lazy, my favorite travel destinations are Galway, Barcelona, Lisbon, and Zell Em See. I would not enjoy life as much without the entertainment of clever comedies - my favorite TV show is the all-time classic Friends, and my one will-see-again-despite-unaffordable-prices Broadway show is the Book of Mormon.

name: Steps to the Casino in Boston. Large, private room
summary: If you are looking for a simple, modest and private room in one of the best location possible in Boston, this is it.  Walk to all the amazing Encore Casino and experience what Boston has to offer. The room is in maybe one of the oldest standalone building in New England. It is on the second floor. Enjoy free wifi and self check in and don’t hesitate to let us know about your plans in advance.  Our guests are mostly medical professionals, students and conference attendees!
space: Very simple and modest. Doors have no locks. Please keep that in mind. Don’t bring expensive items with you. People are very respectful of others.  Bedroom has a padlock!
description: If you are looking for a simple, modest and private room in one of the best location possible in Boston, this is it.  Walk to all the amazing Encore Casino and experience what Boston has to offer. The room is in maybe one of the oldest standalone building in New England. It is on the second floor. Enjoy free wifi and self check in and don’t hesitate to let us know about your plans in advance.  Our guests are mostly medical professionals, students and conference attendees! Very simple and modest. Doors have no locks. Please keep that in mind. Don’t bring expensive items with you. People are very respectful of others.  Bedroom has a padlock!
house_rules: - 1. Quiet hours in the shared areas are from 10 pm to 7 am - 2. No shoes in the house - 3. Communication of arrival time is a must, and double confirming with the host through the airbnb messaging platform about the readiness of your room is a MUST. Please any show ups to the appartment that is not scheduled will be treated as a violation. - 4. Check out is at 9 am. This is important because the cleaning team needs to come to fix the room for the next guest. Kindly respect that.  - 5. There are extra fees with additional non booked guests.  - 6. Leave the keys of the (self check in process) in the master lock and under the mat. This is EXTREMELY important, please. -7. We do have a flexible check in but this means that guests can leave their luggages in the common area while waiting for the previous guest to check out (usually at 9 am) and the cleaning team to clean the room. We want to make it so smooth for the guests, and we would appreciate your cooperation on informing us about you

name: Luxury 3 Story Townhome with Attached 2 Car Garage
summary: Spacious and sun-drenched home available for up to 3 month rental. We are a recently married couple going on a 3 month honeymoon looking to rent our beautiful townhouse. Our favorite features include a working wood burning fireplace, attached 2 car garage and Charles River bike bath in our backyard! Completed rental application needed for approval by condo association.
space: Professional snow removal and house cleaners every other week included in price! Large kitchen with dishwasher and disposal, fully stocked with high end appliances and plenty of items for the at-home cook/baker. En suite bathroom in master bed. Washer/dryer in home. Central A/C and heat. Hardwood floors throughout. High ceilings  and open layout WIFI, cable, HBO, Prime, Netflix on smart TV
description: Spacious and sun-drenched home available for up to 3 month rental. We are a recently married couple going on a 3 month honeymoon looking to rent our beautiful townhouse. Our favorite features include a working wood burning fireplace, attached 2 car garage and Charles River bike bath in our backyard! Completed rental application needed for approval by condo association. Professional snow removal and house cleaners every other week included in price! Large kitchen with dishwasher and disposal, fully stocked with high end appliances and plenty of items for the at-home cook/baker. En suite bathroom in master bed. Washer/dryer in home. Central A/C and heat. Hardwood floors throughout. summary: An elegant, sun-splashed, 2 bedroom (+2offices) apartment with parking, a 15-minute walk or 7-minute bike ride to Harvard (bikes provided).  Enjoy the spacious 1st floor of this stylish 3-level house on a quiet leafy street in Huron Village Cambridge.  Sleeps 5.
space: An elegant, sun-splashed, 2+ bedroom apartment 15-minute walk (or 7-minute bike ride, bikes provided!) to Harvard. Enjoy the spacious 1st floor of a 3-level house on a quiet leafy street in Huron Village, (West) Cambridge.  Sleeps 5. Bedroom 1: queen bed;  Bedroom 2: twin bed & a pull-out double sofa bed.   Recently renovated with designer furnishings and attention to detail. Breakfast at the kitchen bay window overlooking the garden. Enjoy the contemporary bath, full dining room, living room with French doors to a study with "instant" office (wi-fi & printer/scanner/copier provided). European cable lighting, hardwood floors, TV, DVD.  Barbecue or relax in a double hammock in the just-redone backyard (photos coming!) with its bluestone patio and twinkling outdoor lighting. Jog around Fresh Pond or along the Charles River. Browse in Huron Ave. boutiques or Harvard Square shops; enjoy your breakfast here or stroll to Formaggio or Hi-Rise Bakery for latte & croissants.  Walk to Whole Food

neighborhood_overview: Huron Village is known for its charm.  We have playgrounds, a reservoir, small artisans, a used bookstore, antiques, and two bakery-cafes all within walking distance of Harvard Square.  Not to mention the scrumptious take-out, available in several local places. (URL HIDDEN) (URL HIDDEN)
notes: Housecleaning is included with stays over 2 weeks. Laundry facilities are available in the basement.  Just please empty the dryer lint trap before and after, for safety.  In September, I give preference to renting for an academic or full year.  Please note: any discounts apply only to the base nightly rate, not to the additional guest or housecleaning charges and not to the special high-season periods -- college graduation weeks and Christmas/New Year's.)
transit: Two bus lines stop within 3 blocks and 3 T stations and the commuter rail are within walking distance (Harvard Square, the closest, Porter Square, and Alewife, where the GO bus leaves for NYC).
access: Bicycles are available.  Laundry.  Lovely backyard, just redone with wireless access, a large patio, a double hammock & firebowl.
interaction: Your host lives in the second floor unit and is available (or not -- as you prefer) for local tips on where to find the best clam chowder or tapas restaurant, the nearest farmers' market or jogging trail.
house_rules: NO SMOKING is permitted in or around the house, please. No pets, please.  Laundry facilities are available in the basement.  (But please empty the dryer lint trap before and after using it, for safety.)  See the "House Manual" notebook, for information on recycling, trash schedule and other amenities.

host_about: I'm a professor at one of the local universities and a long-time Cambridge resident.  I live with my 19-year old daughter on the second floor at 64 Granville Road.  We  enjoy sharing our "Cambridge tips" with  all of our visitors: where to ice-skate in winter or rent a canoe in summer, the best local places for cheese, bread, and yummy ethnic take-out treats.  We can lend you bikes and direct you to the Minuteman Bikeway, an 11-mile shady ride through Arlington, Lexington and Bedford, or give you a couple of sleds and show you the hill at Fresh Pond.  Whatever the season, we look forward to welcoming you when you're in Cambridge.

host_about:
ABOUT US:

SeamlessTransition is a full-service relocation management agency that also offers quality short-term housing solutions.

SeamlessTransition offers short-term housing options to executives, medical professionals and leisure travelers looking to secure transitional housing in major cities throughout the United States. 

Whether you are relocating by yourself or with your family, SeamlessTransition has spacious, fully furnished apartment homes to suit your needs. We match an individual's or family's short-term housing needs and preferences with available and compatible housing inventory.

Our goal is to find the best short-term accommodations at the best price in the best location to meet your housing needs and preferences.  

The more information you provide us about your housing needs and preferences the easier it will be for us to find housing that will meet your needs and specifications.

We are available Monday through Friday, 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM (EST).
Our Reservation Center closes at 3:00 PM on Friday and will not reopen until Monday morning at 9:00 AM.

We observe all US Federal Holidays.  Kindly excuse our delay in response.

It would be our pleasure to serve you.

name: Lovely Studio Room: Thursdays through Mondays!
summary: We have a large sunny room which comfortably fits a couple, a small family or 3 adults with one sleeping on a covered foam mattress on the floor. Amazing double mattress,  central air-conditioning, cable TV, fridge, microwave, high-speed wifi, en-suite marble bath with great water pressure & long bathtub. Quiet tree-filled Cambridge neighborhood, moments from city life! Safe/warm.
space: We have a peaceful, large, sunny room w/ attached marble bath, a fridge/microwave/toaster oven,  central air, high speed wifi and cable TV. We're on a quiet, tree-lined street in a wonderful part of Cambridge, moments walk to Davis Square. The room comfortably fits a couple with one child on a nice foam mat on floor. (We also have a couple of other rooms which may be available when the studio is full @ $85 extra/night). Here's what else you get: self-serve coffee/tea, micro-wave and fridge in room, hair dryer and iron in bathroom drawer, in-room full cable television, central air conditioning in summer, and use of laundry if you are here for over 4 nights. The studio has lovely decor, and is comfortable, clean and warm.   You'll also get good hosts in the form of myself and my enjoyable (usually!) teenage son. We have a great pup who loves our guests, and we're a short (1/4-1/3 mile) walk to the subway (Davis Square, Porter Square or Alewife stations) and a few minutes walk to the bus
description: We have a large sunny room which comfortably fits a couple, a small family or 3 adults with one sleeping on a covered foam mattress on the floor. Amazing double mattress,  central air-conditioning, cable TV, fridge, microwave, high-speed wifi, en-suite marble bath with great water pressure & long bathtub. Quiet tree-filled Cambridge neighborhood, moments from city life! Safe/warm. We have a peaceful, large, sunny room w/ attached marble bath, a fridge/microwave/toaster oven,  central air, high speed wifi and cable TV. We're on a quiet, tree-lined street in a wonderful part of Cambridge, moments walk to Davis Square. The room comfortably fits a couple with one child on a nice foam mat on floor. (We also have a couple of other rooms which may be available when the studio is full @ $85 extra/night). Here's what else you get: self-serve coffee/tea, micro-wave and fridge in room, hair dryer and iron in bathroom drawer, in-room full cable television, central air conditioning in summer, and u
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quiet and friendly and our street is tree-lined, and known as one of the nicest blocks in what is a great neighborhood. It's far enough away from the main street so you won't hear any noise, yet within moments you can be at the subway or in Davis or Porter Squares. there's a sweet playground nearby, a bike trail extending 19 miles, and many parks. A Whole Foods and Trader Joe's are both within a 15 minute walk.
notes: The bed is a Queen. It has a high end, brand new, double memory-foam mattress topped with a feather bed. It can be made into a couch with no rods or springs and is made for extended use (ie., not a typical 'sofa couch' although I want the room to feel like a studio, and it easily transform into a couch). Many people who sleep on it mention how comfortable it is. The other bed in the room is a single mattress on the floor which is made of organic bamboo, also v. comfortable from all reports.
transit: Very convenient: The 77 bus which goes up and down MA Ave and straight into Harvard Square is within a 5 minute walk, and 3 subway stops Porter, Alewife and Davis) for the Redline are within a 7-15 minute walk depending on your peppiness.
access: Guests have access to their large studio/room, and kitchen for morning coffee. You are welcome to visit the living area of the house by invitation.  If you'd like to use the full kitchen to cook a meal, ask and we can likely arrange that once during your stay if it's under a week, or 1-2 Xs a week if you stay for an extended time. The fidge in your room is big enough to hold at least a few days worth of groceries. There is a desk in your room for working, so please don't spread out anywhere else in the house other than by invitation.
interaction: We like to meet and chat with all of our guests initially upon your arrival and to show you the ropes. After that if  we're both in a friendly mood, we will leave the door to our living space open for you to come in and say hi!
house_rules: 1) We love hosting for airbnb. Our intention is to provide a clean, warm, friendly studio sized room while you're away from your own home on your trip. If you are seeking perfection, anonymity or a locked room, there are tons of lovely hotels in the area; there is not a lock on the room and we do like to get to know our guests a bit. We hope you will express yourself and share the purpose of your trip and something about yourself when you bravely reach out to stay with us in your initial email inquiry. 2) We do charge for children and babies even if they co-sleep with you in your bed.  Please make absolute certain to put the exact # of guests in the initial request/inquiry.   3) We prefer one week's notice before booking if at all possible. You are welcome to try spur of the moment, but the head's up allows us to clear the spot for you. 4)  I try to be flexible with check-in and out times when possible. 5) Just a reminder, no smoking anywhere on this property or outside. Our neighbors
amenities: {"Cable TV",Wifi,"Air conditioning","Pets live on this property",Dog(s),Heating,"Family/kid friendly"}
host_about:
Friendly, smart, politically liberal/progressive, resourceful :) I love hosting people from all over the world, and know the Cambridge/Boston area well (for a native NY'er---I've been here since graduate school which was 20 yrs ago). You will find the environment here 'on the court' restful, peaceful and as my current guest from Australia put it, "I  figured you were a healer of some sort-- because your home feels healing." Our place is relaxing and down to earth, with  an artistic and colorful ambiance, and lots of sunlight.

My boy is pure enjoyment once he feels comfortable with a guest. My dog is one of the sweetest mutts ever (objectively speaking of course)!

If you happen to be taking the bus from NYC, WORLD WIDE BUS leaves you a 10 minute walk from our house.

name: Near Harvard: Safe & Lovely Room
summary: Room next to kitchen and living room in a wonderful condo. This room works best for someone who is a good sleeper and has good boundaries. (although we are quiet and respectful)! Photos share flavor of the artistic, open, bright space and include Mazzy , our sweet dog. Your room is the yellow room with a comfortable mattress on the floor.  Quiet tree-lined street. Very close to public transportation. Harvard U is  walkable distance, also easily accessible by bike, subway, bus.
space: Quiet peaceful room w/shared marble bath, wifi. Here's what else you get: Use of the kitchen for coffee or tea, good hosts, a great pup to visit, access to the T at Davis or Alewife in a 10 minute walk, 5 minutes walk to the bus on MA Ave, restaurants, shops galore--- all within a 1 minute walk outside of our quiet private court. Oh, and you can easily rent a Hubway bike nearby for a quick ride to Tufts, Lesley University or Harvard Square, (20 minutes to MIT).   It's a sunny, friendly to all, tidy home. We especially like grad students and visiting professors.

We spend a lot of time working and studying in the living area so you are welcome to come into the shared space on an invitation-only basis.

host_about: I’ve recently retired from a dozen years as marketing director for the nearby Harvard Museum of Natural History.  My husband John and I are both Harvard grads, appointed years ago to cochair an alumni reunions committee. We enjoy meeting people from all over the world, and sharing our interests in natural history, sailing, books, photography. and sharing our love of Harvard, Cambridge and Boston with visitors. I've travelled widely in my previous work for an international nonprofit, visiting remote corners of the world ranging from Timbuktu, to Yemen, to the kingdom of Tonga and Australia's Kakadu National Park.

neighborhood_overview: Third Square Apartments is located in Kendall Square, a desirable, tech-driven neighborhood in Cambridge. Here, you'll live close to all Cambridge has to offer, including the Charles River, Harvard University and MIT, and an abundance of local shopping, dining and nightlife options to keep you entertained.  Boston-area employers are fond of Kendall Square, too, and some of the world's most well-known companies have offices in the area, making for an easy commute on foot or by transit. Throughout the Kendall Square neighborhood, you'll be amazed by the collection of shopping, dining and entertainment.  In the winter, the 8,400-square-foot skating rink is open seven days a week, while in warmer weather people gather on open plazas for lunch, concerts, a farmer's market, a canoe/kayak rental, and more. Whether you're looking for a place close to school or an up-and-coming area of Cambridge to call home, Kendall Square has everything you're looking for!
transit: The apartment is 1.5 blocks from the Kendall Square T Station and the Cambridge Circular, which goes to the Galleria.  There are multiple bus lines to all parts of the Boston Metro area.

host_about:
ABOUT US:

SeamlessTransition is a full-service relocation management agency that also offers quality short-term housing solutions.

SeamlessTransition offers short-term housing options to executives, medical professionals and leisure travelers looking to secure transitional housing in major cities throughout the United States. 

Whether you are relocating by yourself or with your family, SeamlessTransition has spacious, fully furnished apartment homes to suit your needs. We match an individual's or family's short-term housing needs and preferences with available and compatible housing inventory.

Our goal is to find the best short-term accommodations at the best price in the best location to meet your housing needs and preferences.  

The more information you provide us about your housing needs and preferences the easier it will be for us to find housing that will meet your needs and specifications.

We are available Monday through Friday, 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM (EST).
Our Reservation Center closes at 3:00 PM on Friday and will not reopen until Monday morning at 9:00 AM.

We observe all US Federal Holidays.  Kindly excuse our delay in response.

It would be our pleasure to serve you.

name: Cambridge Getaway @ Harvard & MIT
summary: Charming 2-bedroom apartment on the third floor of our beautiful Victorian home.
space: This is a charming furnished 2 bedroom apartment with a full bathroom, large eat in kitchen, and a living room. It is on the top floor of a well kept Victorian home. It has a small roof deck where you can enjoy your morning coffee or a glass of wine in the evening. The apartment is located within walking distance of MIT and Harvard. Central and Inman Square are less than 5 minutes away. You can walk to fine dining in Inman square where you will find an eclectic mix of restaurants. Downtown Boston is only a 10 minute train ride away. There you will find shopping areas, world-class hospitals, the convention center, and various museums. Our location is truly in Mid-Cambridge. There is a Whole Foods market and a number of cafes just down the street. Rates are subject to change during the busy season Boston Marathon, local graduations, reunions and the Regatta. The apartment is family and small pet friendly as well. There is an additional fee for pets.

You can walk to Harvard or MIT in 10-15 minutes Walkability has a 95% rating. We also have free parking.

name: "The Treehouse":  elegant living near Harvard
summary: An elegant, contemporary top-floor unit in the quiet, green, Huron Village area of Cambridge.  An 18-minute walk to Harvard Square & a 6-minute walk to "the Village", a charming section of Huron Ave. with boutiques, restaurants, galleries, grocer, antique shop, & a used bookstore.  The large backyard hosts 2 patios, a double hammock, lounge chairs, & a croquet lawn. Close to the Minuteman Bike Trail & Fresh Pond.  From 12/21/18 to mid-May; long-term guests only (3 months or more).
space: This stylish, contemporary, architect-designed, skylit, tree-top, compact (650-700 sq. ft.) apartment can sleep 4:  2 in queen bed + 2 on fold-out floor mattresses in either the 2nd bedroom (which is set up as an office) or the living room alcove.  Enjoy the lovely shady patio (with wi-fi), lounge in the quiet backyard in the double hammock.  Stroll to Fresh Pond & Harvard Square in quiet, leafy Huron Village after breakfast at Hi-Rise Bakery.  A perfect Cambridge experience! A beautiful, contemporary architect-designed, skylit, tree-top apartment.  Private entrance.  Sleeps 4:  queen bed in bedroom plus 2 extra pull-out mattresses available for guests or kids in either the nook off the living room or in the separate study.     Gleaming light ash hardwood floors, built-in bookshelves & cubbies, dramatic dormers, European cable lighting, 14' ceilings. Contemporary compact kitchen; large bath with shower & tub, dimmable low-voltage lighting, & roomy storage.  A charming mix of antiques &

neighborhood_overview: Huron Village is known for its charm.  We have playgrounds, a reservoir, small artisans, a used bookstore, antiques, and two bakery-cafes all within walking distance of Harvard Square.  Not to mention the scrumptious take-out, available in several local places. (URL HIDDEN) (URL HIDDEN)
notes: (Please note: the 30% discount applies to the base nightly rate, not to the additional guest or housecleaning charges and not to the special high-season periods -- college graduation weeks and Christmas/New Year's.)
transit: Two bus lines stop within 3 blocks and 3 T stations and the commuter rail are within walking distance (Harvard Square, the closest, Porter Square, and Alewife, where the GO bus leaves for NYC).
access: Two or three bicycles may be available.  Laundry.  Lovely backyard (just redone with wi-fi) with a large patio, a double hammock and a firebowl.
interaction: You host lives in the second floor unit and is available (or not -- as you prefer) for local tips on where to find the best clam chowder or tapas restaurant, the nearest farmers' market or jogging trail.
house_rules: NO SMOKING is permitted in or around the house, please. Shoes should be left in the entrance to the Treehouse to keep the light ash floors gleaming and beautiful.  No pets, please.  Children are welcome, but please be careful around staircases.  If you need a child gate, please let the host know as far in advance as possible.

host_about: I'm a professor at one of the local universities and a long-time Cambridge resident.  I live with my 19-year old daughter on the second floor at 64 Granville Road.  We  enjoy sharing our "Cambridge tips" with  all of our visitors: where to ice-skate in winter or rent a canoe in summer, the best local places for cheese, bread, and yummy ethnic take-out treats.  We can lend you bikes and direct you to the Minuteman Bikeway, an 11-mile shady ride through Arlington, Lexington and Bedford, or give you a couple of sleds and show you the hill at Fresh Pond.  Whatever the season, we look forward to welcoming you when you're in Cambridge.

name: Modern Condo in Harvard Sq
summary: Beautiful spacious condo in a new building perfect for an individual or young couple.
space: One bedroom steps from Huron Village available for long term rental.  1 year minimum. Stainless steel appliances (dishwasher, microwave, disposal, gas stove).  In unit washer and dryer.  Central heating and AC included.  Parking in underground garage included.   The apartment is a 25 minute walk from Harvard and Porter Squares.  Two buses (10min to Harvard Square) stop behind the building.  Walking distance to Whole Foods and Trader Joe's.  Minutes from running loop at Fresh Pond and Danehy Park.   The place comes partially furnished.  Please ping me for details. I'm looking for someone who will treat this place as their own.  Drop me a line and tell me a bit more about yourself!

name: Mid-Cambridge Carriage House
summary: Please let us message together before you make a reservation request as we may have other parties interested in the same times and we want to try to fairly accommodate everyone. We do not accept children but can provide you parking.
space: Please let us message together before you make a reservation request as we may have other parties interested in the same times and we want to try to fairly accommodate everyone. We do not accept children but can provide you parking.   The room is the top floor of wonderful 115-year old carriage house in Mid-Cambridge, half way between Harvard University and MIT. We are equidistant from three major squares in Cambridge – Harvard, Central and Inman Squares. Ten minutes walk to the Red Line, Boston’s subway system connecting to Boston; local bus service is at either end of our street. We offer a gracious, 500 square foot, third floor bedroom loft suite with a full bathroom. It is open to the floors below via a stair. We provide sheets and towels for our guests’ use. We have a pleasant ground floor living/dining/kitchen area and exterior patio that can be lightly used by our guests. We have internet access. We also have a beautiful, friendly cat, Watson and a wonderful small dog, Bella. We

name: Best @ MIT, Kendall, Back Bay, Harvard, BU
summary: Serene and superb daily escape from the high energy of Boston and Cambridge.  This apartment is comfortable for two and is centrally located on a one way street between two one way streets.  Near Central Square, walk to MIT, Harvard and Back Bay.  The bus stops 3/4 of a block away. Experienced travelers only as this is a self-catered apartment.  That said,  it is superior in quality and convenience.
space: Private self-catering (un-hosted) 1 bedroom, sitting room/office, full-size kitchen, full bath, w/d in the unit. All newly refurbished.   There is also a three season room which is for exit only or for an additional fee by the discretion and explicit permission by the host.  We are happy to report that since the upstairs neighbors began renting with airbnb, we have had no complaints about the noise.   We find airbnb guests are more respectful of the neighbors than long term tenants.  As an experienced and frequent solo traveler, I also appreciate a clean safe and economical option for lodging. While I am always open for direct communication,  if you are ever inclined to leave negative public feedback, please look elsewhere.  (I consider negative reviews backstabbing, against the Golden Rule and the 6th Amendment.) Internet, Wifi, basic cable. great natural light. Very easy access to public transportation.  Buses are about 1 - 4 blocks nearby. The T (subway), Red Line, Central Square st

neighborhood_overview: Awesome location, one-way street between two one-way streets makes this gem surprisingly quiet for an urban environment.  Close to Live Entertainment, Charles River, Back Bay, Fenway, Central Square Theatre, dance, yoga, healthy food, boutique cafe's and shopping.  A safe, culturally diverse, historic neighborhood of graduate students, young professional families, and a booming bio-tech industry. The location is just a few blocks to Central Square, Mass Ave. great food and entertainment. While the apartment can be quite serene and restorative, it is centrally located and convenient to any of the hot spots in Cambridge or Boston.
notes: Turn-key, well appointed, super clean.  I trust you will love this place and want to return every time you visit Boston or Cambridge!!!
transit: Bus at each corner, MBTA Central Square "T" station 6 short blocks.  Mass Ave. busses, 4 blocks. I might also suggest you use Hubway,  shared bike system.  Nearly all main attractions are within ~5 miles.
access: Main room with queen size bed, desk, TV, and closet.   Full-size eat-in kitchen. Full Bath.
interaction: I am always available via tele or text unless I am temporarily out of range. Our housekeeper and manager lives in Boston.
house_rules: Take care of the place.  No smoking.  No pets. No oil or coffee grounds in the drains. Quiet hours 10 pm - 9am

neighborhood_overview: Third Square Apartments is located in Kendall Square, a desirable, tech-driven neighborhood in Cambridge. Here, you'll live close to all Cambridge has to offer, including the Charles River, Harvard University and MIT, and an abundance of local shopping, dining and nightlife options to keep you entertained. Boston-area employers are fond of Kendall Square, too, and some of the world's most well-known companies have offices in the area, making for an easy commute on foot or by transit. Throughout the Kendall Square neighborhood, you'll be amazed by the collection of shopping, dining and entertainment. In the winter, the 8,400-square-foot skating rink is open seven days a week, while in warmer weather people gather on open plazas for lunch, concerts, a farmer's market, a canoe/kayak rental, and more. Whether you're looking for a place close to school or an up-and-coming area of Cambridge to call home, Kendall Square has everything you're looking for!
transit: The apartment is 1.5 blocks from the Kendall Square T Station and the Cambridge Circular, which goes to the Galleria.  There are multiple bus lines to all parts of the Boston Metro area.
interaction: Guests will have a 24-hour Customer Service Line should they require assistance during their stay.
house_rules: NO Smoking.   No Pets.
