neighborhood_overview: Private standalone carriage house artists loft.  Walking distance to Harvard, MIT and HBS. Transportation including Redline T, bus and Hubway bikes steps away! Fantastic Parks, Restaurants, Pubs, Music, Whole Foods, Starbucks & Local Coffee Shops, Bookstores! Uber, Lyft, SAFR, and Taxis in abundance.
notes: Our loft is not currently handicap accessible as it is a separate standalone carriage house next in the backyard next to our building.  Guests get to the loft by walking up 3 steps from the sidewalk  and continuing down our side yard path to another set of 2 steps.  If you do need wheelchair access we can discuss other possible options with you in hopes to accommodate everyone. We do have 2 dogs (Pixel and Glitch) in our home which is next door to our loft and shares the patio space. When we have guests in the loft we try to keep them out of site as much as possible, but they are at times in the yard. They are incredibly friendly and lovable, but they do tend to bark to say hello as well as at the neighbor's dog so please let us know before booking if that may be an issue as we can make sure they do not go in the yard when you are outside. Your relaxing stay is important to us so please don't be shy if it's an issue for you.
transit: - Bus at the bottom of our street on Massachusetts Ave. - Redline T (subway) under 2 blocks away. - Hubway bike stop at bottom of our street - Uber, Lyft, SAFR, and Taxis in abundance - Metered spaces at the bottom of our street - A few garages a few blocks away within walking distance
access: Entire private stand alone artist Carriage House Loft with private yard.
interaction: As little or much as needed to make sure your work/business stay is easy and low maintenance.
house_rules: CALENDAR AVAILABILITY: Checkin- AFTER 4pm. Checkout by 10am. SMOKING RULES: ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKERS!!! Only guests listed in reservation are allowed.  Please take shoes off inside CHILDREN: We love kids! - But unfortunately due to funkiness of the loft,  it is unsafe for young children as their are no safety children railings on the steps or platform loft.  Please inquire if you have young children. Pets: (no pets allowed in the loft unfortunately) While we absolutely adore dogs (and have two ourselves).  We can't have them stay in our loft and need to be considerate to all our guests - including those with allergies.  Sorry for the inconvenience.  Please inquire if you have questions. DEPARTURE RULES: FOOD: Please do not leave any food (opened or unopened) anywhere inside our loft. This includes anything you've stored inside our refrigerator, cabinets, or on the counters. TOWELS: Please do not use our good clean white spa towels for anything other than after your shower! If you need tow

name: Lovely Guest Room (Women Only)
space: Small, clean, sunny, guest room with shared bath and kitchen in excellent location for short term stay near Harvard University and Lesley University. The room has a new, comfortable twin bed with quality linens. There is a shared kitchen and bath with owner, who is a yoga teacher and artist.  The neighborhood is safe and beautiful with many historic homes, within walking distance to Harvard Square and Porter Square (where you can take the red line mass transit, called "The T, short for MBTA). The apartment is on the third floor. It is a short walk to shopping and restaurants. Incredible Hi-Rise cafe and bakery just a block away, and gourmet Bagelsaurus in the other direction. Many wonderful restaurants in the area, including good vegetarian options -  my favorite is Life Alive in Central Square near City Hall.  There is no a/c but a window fans cools the room nicely in summer. I offer a selection of herbal teas.  Wi-fi included.  On street visitor parking. I have used air bnb myself wo
description: Small, clean, sunny, guest room with shared bath and kitchen in excellent location for short term stay near Harvard University and Lesley University. The room has a new, comfortable twin bed with quality linens. There is a shared kitchen and bath with owner, who is a yoga teacher and artist. neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a safe walking area, with public transportation nearby as well. There are many historic homes in the area with great architecture. Just blocks from Harvard University there is a feeling of history and academia. There are shops, restaurants, and cafes within easy walking distance. One of my favorites, is Hi Rise a cafe/bakery with great coffee, tea, baked goods, and meals, and also Urban Hearth for breakfast or lunch, and also prix fixe dinner.
notes: I do not provide shampoo and soaps because I find women tend to have products they like and bring with them. However, there are nice soaps in the bathroom and you are welcome to use them.
transit: Easy walking distance (10 mins) to Harvard Square, and in the other direction, Porter Square. Both Harvard and Porter are on the Red Line T with easy access to the entire area. Several bus lines nearby. The city system of bike rentals (The Hubway) has ports a few blocks away. Cambridge is an easy walking city, but there is ample public transportation too. If you are traveling from the airport, it is easy to take the Silver Line to Red Line to Porter Square. Or, take Uber. If you are new to Uber, let me know and I will send you a link for a free first ride.
interaction: I am a teacher and sometimes quite busy, other times I have more free time. I usually interact with guests some, and take cues from the needs of the particular individual.
house_rules: Quiet, mature, respectful women only. Non-smoking. There is only room for one person, so no additional guests. Please do not use strong perfumes as it might cause problems for the next guest. Thank you!

space: This is a 1 bedroom apartment on the second floor on a beautiful victorian house in Harvard Sq (**limited parking**— please see details below).

house_rules: Overall Cleanliness and Tidiness: You MUST leave everything clean, organized and tidy in the common areas and when you check out. Not doing so may result in withholding part, or all, of your security deposit.  Trash & Recycling (*important*) You MUST dispose of things properly. This means separating true trash from things you can recycle. You must do this both in your apartment and especially if you take it out to the large bins outside. The City of Cambridge will fine us if trash and recycling are not placed properly and we will send you this bill if we get it and note this in your guest review. This means: ---> recyclables (paper, plastic, aluminum, glass) must be CLEAN (for example: no plastic containers with food still in it: put the food in the compost (ideal) or trash (not the sink! we may have to charge you if it gets clogged and the plummer comes over. The pipes are fragile. Please only put water in the sink).  --->trash must be in plastic (not paper!) bags and TIED UP TIGHTLY.

host_about:
Welcome to The Cambridge Karma House!

¡Bienvenidos a La Casa de Karma!

We wanted a name that embodies our feelings and philosophy around hosting, and essentially it is about karma- the notion that our actions and intentions will come back to us and influence our future, whether they be positive or negative. Karma is similar to the golden rule of “treat others the way you want to be treated." We believe that this is a good way to go through the world and attempt to always practice this with our guests. We will try to always treat you with loving kindness and respect, and we expect the same from our guests--that they treat the folks running the house, other guests in the house, and the space itself, with respect and kindness.

This Victorian house built in the 1880s and still has many of the quirks from that era. Around 30 years ago our family bought the property, and in 2013 we started managing and renovating its 6 apartments and established the Cambridge Karma House LLC!

We enjoy hosting our guests & we look forward to meeting you! Please let us know if you need anything or have questions.

We try to always be friendly and caring to our guests so please do let us know if there's anything we can do to make your stay more comfortable.

CHECK-IN=any time after 3pm*

CHECK-OUT=12 noon or earlier*

*if you need to check in before 3pm or check out after 12 noon, please let us know and we will *try* to accommodate you (you MUST receive a confirmation that this is okay). If we’re not able to accommodate you with an early check-in or late check-out time, we are almost always able to offer our guests the ability to store their luggage in the basement during non-apartment-stay hours.

---> The details of our check-in and check-out procedures are *automatically* emailed to confirmed guests by airbnb through our “House Manual”; the House Manual covers a variety of topics but we ask that you ****privilege what is written here**** regarding parking, plumbing, tidiness + cleanliness, and waste disposal (we are in the process of updating the House Manuals on all of our listings but sometimes our systems, etc. change this places is the quickest go-to place to relay/outline what we need our guests to know and/or do). 

IMPORTANT NOTES (parking, plumbing, tidiness + cleanliness, and waste disposal)*:

*Please privilege guest expectations and procedures written here over those received in the "House Manual”

**************PARKING**************:

We canNOT offer parking to most of our guests. We have 1 visitors parking pass for 6 units (maximum 3 days in a row in the zone indicated behind the pass (to be placed on the dashboard) & the vehicle must be moved every 24 hours); if you want the pass YOU MUST ASK us *****AND**** receive a message confirming that, indeed, you may use it (it is in high demand and often unavailable).

Due to the limited availability of parking in Cambridge (both through the house and in Cambridge overall), we suggest you not bring a car.

**************PLUMBING**************

While there are many fantastic and charming features of the old Victorian house, the old pipes are not one of them! Therefore:

YOU ***MUST*** USE THE HAIR AND FOOD CATCHERS IN ALL OF THE DRAINS. Indeed, WATER (/polarity bonded liquids (no oil)) IS THE ONLY THING THAT CAN GO DOWN THE SINKS AND TUB. Not doing so will clog up the pipes; if we need to call the plumber we may keep part, all of your security deposit to remedy the situation.

**************TIDINESS & CLEANLINESS of Your Living Space When Checking Out**************

There is a short window period between checking-in and checking-out and oftentimes we are booked back to back with multiple apartments to prepare. If your apartment takes more than about an hour to clean it is likely we will draw from your deposit for this extra service of your apartment requiring a deep cleaning after you check out. Crumbs and food all over the tables and counters (or food in the trash; see below under "Compost"!), spilled products on the bathroom sink, this is not what we expect to encounter to turn around the apartment to the next guest. The apartments are large and wiping all the surfaces down, cleaning the floors and changing the bedding and towels in the most basic way usually takes about an hour. In a way we're trying to clean invisible things (germs, finger prints, dust, etc.) form one guest to the next; when we clean and prepare apartments we do not expect to have to pick-up-after-you.

A my j**************WASTE DISPOSAL: COMPOSTING + RECYCLING + TRASH************** :

Our Earth is under seriously strained circumstances in terms of how much toxic matter humans are exposing it to, and as such, we take waste production seriously. The best sustainable practice mantra is (in this order): reduce, reuse, recycle.

GUESTS STAYING UNDER ONE WEEK:

Please leave your trash, recyclables and compost INSIDE of the apartment and KINDLY DO NOT take it outside. If you need to take it out for some reason, please see the “where" section for each type of waste.

GUESTS STAYING OVER ONE WEEK:

Take your trash, recyclables and compost to the 19 side of the house and put them IN THE PROPER BINS (if you are unable to do so for medical reasons, please let us know and we will gladly do this for you!). The trash and recycling is collected at around 7am Wednesday morning (one day later on weeks where there are national holidays);

********TRASH********

WHAT? anything that is NOT compostable (food) or recyclable (paper, glass, aluminum, plastic). Examples: styrofoam, dirt and hair (though these last 2 can put in the garden)….most (clean) materials can be recycled! :-)

WHERE? Indoors: in the bin marked “Trash.” Outdoors: in the BLACK OR GREY bins (these are smaller than the recycling bins).

HOW? In TIGHTLY SEALED PLASTIC BAGS. You CANNOT leave the bags unsealed (this disrespects the folks collecting the trash by risking waste falling out while disposing of it) and/or the City will reject the bin likely fine us (and we will have no qualms about passing this on to you (by withholding your security deposit).

********RECYCLING********

WHAT?

Paper (example: receipts, newspaper, tissues, cereal boxes)

Glass (for example:bottles),

Aluminum (for example:cans)

Hard Plastics (for example: your clean (see below) yoghurt containers, to-go food containers, etc.….*****You must KEEP SOFT PLASTICS (for example: plastic bags) SEPARATE from other recyclable materials*****; these clog the recycling sorting machine. We put these together outside (either in a small bin by the compost wheel and/or in a large bag full of soft plastics (mostly bags)!

** VERY IMPORTANT NOTE: all materials MUST BE CLEAN. This means that you have to rinse out you milk cartons, clean out containers containing food (put excess food in the compost (**NEVER down the sink drain**; see “Plumbing”).

WHERE?

Indoors: in the bin marked “Recycling.”

Outdoors: in the LARGE NAVY BLUE BINS (everything goes in there EXCEPT for your soft plastics (for example: plastic bags); put these in the small container by the compost wheel or in a large plastic bag full of soft plastics).

vHOW?

WI
********COMPOST********

I N sA Isis WHAT?

IAll of your food scraps (for example: fruits peels, tea bags, coffee grinds, vegetable scraps, etc.) EXCEPT for meat and dairy (egg shells are fine!). What do do with these food caught in the kitchen sink? Throw it in the zip lock bag in the freezer :)

name: Great House, Great Location
space: This beautiful, three-bedroom, 2 1/2 bath, fully furnished home is available for couples and families who want an affordable way to visit a great city. The location and space are ideal for a scholar coming to Harvard or MIT, or a for a family coming on business or to visit one of Boston's hospitals.  It's also a wonderful spot from which to visit Boston and Cambridge. 1 block to bus, minutes to Harvard, MIT, and downtown Boston.  Great neighborhood, parking space, utilities and wi-fi included.  There is a washer and dryer and everything you could need to have a great time. 1st floor: open floor plan with kitchen, dr, lr & 1/2 bath 2nd Floor: one bedroom with a twin that sleeps 1; another bedroom with bunkbeds that sleep 2 on the bottom and 1 on top; a TV room (it's an open room with no doors) that has a futon that sleeps 2. 3rd Floor: a full size bed that sleeps 2. Plus we have an air mattress that could go in any of the bedrooms. We live in a great neighborhood, with lots of parks, re

The location and space are ideal for a scholar coming to Harvard or MIT, or a for a family coming on business or to visit one of Boston's hospitals.  It's also a wonderful spot from which to visit Boston and Cambridge. 1 block to bus, minutes to Harvard, MIT, and downtown Boston.  Great neighborhood, parking space, utilities and wi-fi included.  There is a washer and dryer and everything you could need to have a great time. 1st floor: open floor plan with kitchen, dr, lr & 1/2 bath 2nd Floor: one bedroom with a twin that sleeps 1; another bedroom with bunkbeds that sleep 2 on the bottom and 1 on top; a TV room (it's an open room with no doors) that has a futon that sleeps 2. 3rd Floor: a full size bed that sleeps 2. Plus we have an air mattress that could go in any of the bedrooms. We live in a great neighborhood, with lots of parks, re
neighborhood_overview: We live in a great Cambridge neighborhood, centrally located so that you can walk to Boston to see the Red Sox or Harvard to catch a speaker.  We have great restaurants, street parking, and tons of playgrounds.  Honestly, I don't know why everyone doesn't live here, but I'm glad they don't.  :)
transit: We are half a block from the bus and .3 miles from the T (Boston's subway system).
access: Guests will have access to the entire house, the back deck, the back patio and one parking space.
interaction: I usually greet guests when they get here and show them around the place.  They have my cell number in case there are problems while they are here.  If I can't be there to greet someone, I send them a welcome packet and the key through the mail.
house_rules: SMOKING: No smoking of any kind allowed.  If smoking is detected, a cleaning service will be hired, and the guest will incur the cost. PETS:  No animal, fowl, fish, reptile and/or pet of any kind shall be kept on or about the premises, for any amount of time, without obtaining the written consent and meeting the requirements of the OWNER. PARKING:  Resident will have access to one assigned parking space on the property. No other parking space shall be used by RESIDENT or RESIDENT’S guest(s).  RESIDENT is responsible for oil leaks and other vehicle discharges for which RESIDENT shall be charged for cleaning if deemed necessary by OWNER. NOISE:  RESIDENT agrees not to cause or allow any noise or activity on the premises which might disturb the peace and quiet of another neighbor.  Said noise and/or activity shall be a breach of this agreement.

host_about: We've been in Cambridge for more than 20 years, and we love it here!  Jeff renovated our house ten years ago, and since then we've loved sharing it with others.  We'd be happy to help you get settled and find your way around.  It's hard not to have a good time in Boston/Cambridge - even harder when you're staying in a house set up to make you comfortable while you're away from your own home.  Whether your kids want to play with the trains, you want to cook a gourmet meal in the fully stocked kitchen, or just want a cheaper place to sleep, we think you'll love it here.

host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
working professional living in New York. recently relocated to Singapore for one year maybe two Chinese-American. Enjoy traveling, reading books, classic music, cooking and sports. I am a world traveller, enjoy meeting people and making friends. I am very easy going, and open minded.... I am warm and hospitable. I treat my guests as friends, and I have built valuable and enriching friendships with a few of my guests in the past two years. It is priceless. 
I am a big fan of Airbnb. I open my home to welcome guests from all around the world. 
So I welcome you to Boston and New York. Hope our paths will cross some day.

name: New condo in Central Sq - 2BR, 2BA
summary: Close to MIT and Harvard. Just 5 minute walk to the Red Line T stop and Mass Ave.
space: **Please note the property has a friendly cat** City of Cambridge STR registration #14608 Your own private 2BR, 2BA condo in the center of Cambridge, MA where you can get virtually anywhere in Boston or Cambridge easily by walking and excellent public transportation!  We're hoping the condo can get some use when we are out of town. Located in Central Square, Cambridge one of the best locations in Boston. The location is perfect whether your stay is for business or pleasure. Location: Right between MIT and Harvard (Both are 5 minutes away by public transport, or a lovely 15-20 min walk).   Transportation: A five minute walk from Central Square subway ‘T’ stop on the Red Line; the #1 Bus which runs up and down Massachusetts Avenue; and a cab stands. Our Central Square station is only 3 stops (a 10 minute ride) to downtown Boston over the beautiful Charles River.  This is a great location for visiting Cambridge colleges and universities. There is safe on-street parking in our neighborhood

Just 5 minute walk to the Red Line T stop and Mass Ave. **Please note the property has a friendly cat** City of Cambridge STR registration #14608 Your own private 2BR, 2BA condo in the center of Cambridge, MA where you can get virtually anywhere in Boston or Cambridge easily by walking and excellent public transportation! Our Central Square station is only 3 stops (a 10 minute ride) to downtown Boston over the beautiful Charles River.  This is a great location for visiting Cambri
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is the most diverse in Cambridge with lots of restaurants and live music plus grocery stores and public tranportation
notes: Our cat will be with you during your stay.  She is extremely friendly and does cat things like sleep and meow and sit on objects (like your suitcase) and poop/pee in her litter box. We don't recommend staying with us if you are uncomfortable with cats, cat hair, etc.
transit: The best way to get around is walking, biking or taking the T subway.  Bikes can be rented via Hubway and local bike shops. We have extra T passes you can reload and use during your stay.  Walking/tour maps are available for you to use during your stay. You can park one car in the neighborhood with our guest parking pass, which must be returned after your stay.  There is also pay-to-park options like Green Street Garage ($20/day).
access: You will be given a code to access our key lockbox.
interaction: We will be out of town whenever airbnb guests are staying with us.
house_rules: Please strive to leave our house the same way you found it when you arrived. Smoking outside house is fine, not inside, just clean up your butts. Light drinking, but respect our neighbors by keeping voices and music moderate. Please provide your own alcohol and leave ours, though you're welcome to enjoy any of the food in the fridge and cabinets and use any laundry detergent and other household supplies you need. Please be mindful of the wood surfaces and use coasters and trivets for drinks and warm/hot containers. Have fun, enjoy the condo and Cambridge.  We like to protect the earth so please recycle; everything recyclable can be put in one co-mingled bin, take reasonable showers, and turn off the lights when you're not around. Good karma household rules. Good karma rules the house.

host_about:
I live and work in Cambridge, MA, but I grew up in Maryland outside of DC.  I work as a community organizer for the City of Cambridge to promote energy efficiency and renewable energy. I'm married, have a friendly cat and two young children.  I love my Central Square neighborhood, exploring new restaurants and doing new things.  I walk/bike or take the T pretty much everywhere, though my zipcar membership gets me out of town for camping and skiing.

I practice Bikram Yoga and spend my weekends either hanging out with friends or doing/dreaming about home improvements.

name: Davis Square Studio!
summary: Lovely, cozy alcove studio apartment on first floor in a happening neighborhood. Tastefully decorated. Walk 2 blocks to Square for restaurants, coffee shops, or pubs or take subway 2 stops to Harvard Square and walk around the historic campus.
space: The studio has a double bed (SAATVA organic luxury mattress), living and dining area, and a breakfast table in the kitchen. You can cook in or eat out. On street parking with my permit. I do not own a TV hopefully you will be having too much fun to notice :-) Quiet apartment and street. Nice shade tree in front in summer or air conditioner on the hottest days. Please note the professional Airbnb photos were taken with a wide angle lens and give the apartment an appearance of larger size.
description: Lovely, cozy alcove studio apartment on first floor in a happening neighborhood. Tastefully decorated. Walk 2 blocks to Square for restaurants, coffee shops, or pubs or take subway 2 stops to Harvard Square and walk around the historic campus. The studio has a double bed (SAATVA organic luxury mattress), living and dining area, and a breakfast table in the kitchen. You can cook in or eat out. On street parking with my permit. I do not own a TV hopefully you will be having too much fun to notice :-) Quiet apartment and street. Nice shade tree in front in summer or air conditioner on the hottest days. Please note the professional Airbnb photos were taken with a wide angle lens and give the apartment an appearance of larger size. Studio with alcove bed, fully equipped kitchen and bath. I will happily welcome and orient you and it's yours to enjoy. I am available to answer any questions or make suggestions on how to enjoy your stay. Walk two blocks to cafes, restaurants, movie theatre, hip
neighborhood_overview: Walk two blocks to cafes, restaurants, movie theatre, hip bars, ice cream or your choice of two frozen yogurt purveyors. Musicians in Square in summer. Very vibrant!
notes: There is  a hard copy of house manual that I hope answers questions and helps make your stay here comfortable and contains neighborhood restaurant menus.
transit: Subway and buses two blocks away with easy access to all parts of city.  Hubway bikes is also two blocks away if you chose to tour city on bicycle. Remember to wear a helmet :-)  Parking permit available for 3 day on street parking if you will have a car.
access: Studio with alcove bed, fully equipped kitchen and bath.
interaction: I will happily welcome and orient you and it's yours to enjoy. I am available to answer any questions or make suggestions on how to enjoy your stay.
house_rules: Apartment building is quiet and I expect guests to respect that ambiance during stay.  Though I love both children and pets, pets are not allowed in building and the apartment is not suitable for children.

host_about: I am on my third career: Psychotherapist, previously a Graphic Designer and Yoga Instructor.  I love taking advantage of vibrancy of Boston area, where I live: art, theatre, movies, lectures, etc. I  am also content being home, like to cook vegetarian meals and read. Believe it or not, I have not owned a TV for decades, though with computers it is not much of a miss!

name: Apartment in Harvard's Backyard
space: Gorgeous apartment in the ideal Cambridge location!  It's a spacious and well-laid out one-bedroom - perfect for a couple. It has a nice size living room with incredible sunlight. It's in the tallest building on our street, so from the couch, we see treetops out of all four living room windows! The bedroom has a full size bed, an enormous closet, AC, and 2 windows. Even the bathroom gets sunlight so bright that you feel like you're showering outside! The kitchen is awesome - marble countertops, dishwasher, etc. There are also hardwood floors throughout (minus kitchen and bathroom). There's laundry and bike storage in the basement and a shared yard to boot!   Because we often get asked: we have a full-size bed in the bedroom, which is perfect for a couple.  When one bed is not enough, we host guests in the living room on our very comfortable Crate and Barrel couch (which is slightly narrower than a twin bed) and on our top-of-the-line full size air mattress.   We're smack between Harvar

interaction: I usually mail guests keys so that they can let themselves in and out!
house_rules: Welcome to 9 Ellery!  Please make yourself at home.  Please please please also remember that this is still our actual home and we love all of the things we’ve left there for you to enjoy!   Cambridge is a great place and there are plenty of things to do right in our neighborhood.   Supermarkets: The closest supermarket is a Whole Foods on Prospect Street between Mass Ave and Harvard.  Market Basket is further away (you can walk there and take a taxi home if you don’t have a car).  There are a couple of other markets in Central Square (an Indian grocer and further down, a Korean grocer, and they both sell some produce, and a huge H-Mart just past Prospect St.).  There are also lots of Farmer’s Markets – you can search for Cambridge Farmer’s Markets and get a big list.  Trader Joe’s, down on Memorial Drive, is also walkable if you’re up for a trek.  The best kept summer secret is the Harvard Garden, which is on Mount Auburn close to Holyoke Street.  On Fridays around 3-6pm, the undergrad

name: Holidays in Cambridge $150/night (flexible)
summary: Spend the holidays in this elegant, contemporary, top-floor apartment, walking distance to Harvard.  Sleeps 2 in the bedroom and 2 more on comfy pull-out foam mattresses.  Conveniently located near cute boutiques, yummy bakeries, a used bookstore, & cafes, and close to public transportation, the house sits on a quiet street in Huron Village.   Fully outfitted, including bicycles.  A perfect nest from which to explore Cambridge and Boston's holiday delights.
space: The Treehouse: Elegance at the top This elegant, furnished contemporary architect-designed, skylit, tree-top apartment sleeps 4:  a queen bed in the bedroom, plus a pull-out chair-bed and another pull-out foam mattress that can be used either in the guest alcove or the study.  This stylish top floor in a two-family house in quiet, leafy Huron Village, a 15 minute walk from Harvard, welcomes you with gleaming light ash hardwood floors, built-in bookshelves & cubbies, dramatic dormers, European cable lighting and 14' ceilings. The contemporary compact kitchen has a microwave/convection oven; the large bath with shower & tub has dimmable low-voltage lighting, & roomy storage. A charming mix of antiques & contemporary pieces will provide a comfortable place to put your feet up after a long day.  In good weather, use the bikes (included) or take a short walk to Radcliffe (10 min), Harvard (15 min), Fresh Pond (5 min), Huron Avenue cafes & shops (Formaggio, Hi-Rise Bakery, 5 min), Whole Food

The con
neighborhood_overview: Huron Village is a lovely section of Cambridge between Harvard Square and Fresh Pond. It has its own little strip of shops that includes a grocer,  a used book store, Formaggio, which specializes in cheese and other Gourmet items, Hi-Rise bakery, a boutique for women, a great toy store, and our own Marimekko.  Porter Square is also within walking distance. And Fresh Pond, with its two and a half mile jogging trail, is a few blocks away.
transit: We are close to 3 bus lines that go directly to Harvard Square.  We are also only a 16-minute walk from Harvard Square and 18 minutes from Porter Square and Alewife.  We have on-street parking with a visitor pass.
access: Enjoy the backyard, with patio, double hammock and Wi-Fi.
interaction: I will be here if you need anything or have questions about the best place for clam chowder or the coolest toy stores. I can even help you find a babysitter.
house_rules: To keep the noise down and the floors gleaming, shoes stay in the second floor entrance room before you go up to the treehouse.  Please conserve energy:  turn down air-conditioners when you leave and turn off lights. A recycling bin is provided.  Trash barrels are in the driveway.  Please use them. Absolutely no smoking, please.  Not in the apartment and not on the premises.

host_about: I'm a professor at one of the local universities and a long-time Cambridge resident.  I live with my 19-year old daughter on the second floor at 64 Granville Road.  We  enjoy sharing our "Cambridge tips" with  all of our visitors: where to ice-skate in winter or rent a canoe in summer, the best local places for cheese, bread, and yummy ethnic take-out treats.  We can lend you bikes and direct you to the Minuteman Bikeway, an 11-mile shady ride through Arlington, Lexington and Bedford, or give you a couple of sleds and show you the hill at Fresh Pond.  Whatever the season, we look forward to welcoming you when you're in Cambridge.

name: East Cambridge Apartment
summary: Our three bedroom home is tucked away in a wonderful neighborhood in East Cambridge.  Walk to great neighborhood restaurants and enjoy day trips to Boston with easy access to bus and train lines.  Enjoy the backyard and charm of Cambridge.
space: Location, location, location!  It is conveniently located a mile from Harvard Square, steps away from MIT, and a ten minute walk to Charles River and multiple T stops to travel to Boston.  This is an 1854 home that has been entirely renovated.   Apartment has driveway, a backyard, an updated kitchen, 1 double bed in one bedroom, 2 twins in the bedroom and a bunk bed in the third (2 twins).  The apartment is located in Kendall Square and a short walk to many bars and restaurants.  Apartment has high ceilings, washer/dryer in kitchen, flat screen tv, and feels far bigger than 1300 sq. feet.
description: Our three bedroom home is tucked away in a wonderful neighborhood in East Cambridge.  Walk to great neighborhood restaurants and enjoy day trips to Boston with easy access to bus and train lines.  Enjoy the backyard and charm of Cambridge.    Location, location, location! I will be out of town of the dates that they arrive and visit.  I will be readily
neighborhood_overview: Neighborhood is tucked away behind MIT and Kendall Square.  East Cambridge still has a strong Portuguese population that is apparent with grape vines surrounding our yard.  Our oldest son goes to school down the street and we love the community and our neighborhood.
transit: Bus at the end of our street can take you to Harvard Square.  Red Line for train is about a 10-15 minute walk and can take you across the river to Boston.
access: No keys involved, you will receive a 4 digit code to access the apartment.
interaction: I will be out of town of the dates that they arrive and visit.  I will be readily available to contract through phone or email and have someone to help you at any time if needed.
house_rules: House Rules Welcome to Cambridge!  We are so happy to be able to share our home with you.  We ask that you treat it with the same care and respect you would your own.  Please don’t hesitate to call, e-mail, or text us with any questions or concerns.  We have tenants who live upstairs and use the washing machine in the basement so you may hear them in the hallway or stairs. Check In: 3PM Check Out: 12PM Let us know if this is not convenient and we will do our best to accommodate you. Trash and Recycling is every Thursday.  Please bring the bins out to the curb.  No need to sort the recycling (paper and plastic). TV Remote Internet Access The cable box is located in the basement so the television and cable is operated by a “remote eye” located on the mantle.  When turning the tv on or changing the channel you must point the remote at the eye.  To turn the television on press the red “All On” button located on the top of the remote.  If the screen is blue then just press the cable button

host_about:
My wife and I are teachers north of Boston and have 4 children.  We enjoy traveling, being active, and spending time in Cape Cod and Lake Ontario.
  
As a family we enjoy seeing different places and experiencing different cultures.  We love the concept of airbnb and the idea of communal living.  As a young family we love the idea of living somewhere else and having the flexibility/comforts of a kitchen and bedrooms. 

Rocco is 7 years old and he loves Ancient Egypt and karate.  Theo is 4 and he enjoys cars and diggers.   Colton is also 4 and he enjoys sleeping and baseball.  Adeline is 2 and loves her mom.

name: Studio steps from MIT and Harvard!
space: Perfect spot to visit MIT, Harvard, BU, or any of Boston and Cambridge! The space is located in the garden level of our home with its own separate, private entrance and a private full bathroom! The room comes with a flat screen TV w/cable (Sho-time and HBO), Wi-Fi, microwave, toaster, and refrigerator.  NOTE: There is NO kitchen- no stove, oven, or sink. Think of it more as an enhanced hotel room. You will have a very nice, clean room, comfortable bed, and, of course, clean sheets and towels!  Enjoy being in the heart of Cambridge! This Central Square house is located 5 walking minutes from the Red Line and many bus lines. Easy access to Harvard, MIT, BU, Downtown Boston, Mass. General Hospital, TD Garden (for all concerts, hockey, and basketball games!), and Fenway Park!  In the neighborhood you will find a Star Market, two Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, a grocery Coop, countless independent coffee shops, book stores, and restaurants. Shopping is just a short distance to Harvard Square, N

Shopping is just a short distance to Harvard Square, N
neighborhood_overview: It's very quiet, but only a 5 minute walk from everything you could need in Central Square. The convenience is unbeatable. We are located next to one of Cambridge's public gardens, and in the summer time it is absolutely beautiful.
notes: Because you are have a private entrance, we ask that you do not send deliveries to 10 watson st, as they will come to our front door. If you need to order food or meet a friend, please ask them to call you before they arrive so that you can meet them out front. The house is part of a condo unit with close neighbors and so I ask you to be please considerate of the neighbors and keep your noise levels down, especially after 11PM. All of this is done in the spirit of sharing in the airbnb community. Thank you!
transit: The Red Line, Boston's best subway line, is only a 5 minute walk away. The #1 Bus is also only a 5 minute walk away, and the #47 bus, which takes you down by Fenway Park, stops only a one minute walk away!
access: Enjoy a huge, clean, private room/studio with its own private entrance and private bathroom. Unbeatable location. Cable TV, WiFi, coffee maker, electric kettle, refrigerator, microwave, and toaster oven. (Please note that there is no actual kitchen/oven)
interaction: I rarely meet the guests, as their room and bathroom is on a different level than my regular living quarters. I always inform the guests if I do have to enter "their rented space" (sometimes i need something from the storage room), but mostly, unless a guest would like to meet me, i allow them to enjoy their time and space privately. I am always home upstairs; however, in case they need anything (and because I live there :) ).
house_rules: Part (or maybe most) of Boston's charm is that it is one of America's oldest cities. That means that the homes are often hundreds of years old, and ours is no exception!  Please do not put any food stuffs or other non liquids down the drains. There are garbage cans outside of the house to toss your left over food or any other items that need immediate disposal.  Do NOT flush paper towels or food! Do NOT put food down the sink or tub drains or toilet. There is no smoking in the house, but feel free to step outside. Just clean up after yourself :)  Even if your stay is under 3 days, I need to know in advance of your parking needs! You must park on the street (not in neighbors' driveways) and you must RETURN the parking pass to us. We only get one pass a year so if you don't leave it for us, that means other guests (plus our own friends and family) can no longer come to visit with a car. Thanks!

host_about:
Hi! I am Claudia. I was born in Miami, where I  spent 3 whole weeks before moving to Bahrain where my family was living. The daughter of an Argentine and Italian, I speak English, Spanish, Italian, and French. I spent 3 years as a child in Paris, attended art school in London, and have lived in Boston for the past 15 years or so. 

I am currently the Design Director at Artists For Humanity - a local non-profit that provides art and design paid employment to Boston's under-resourced teens. 

I love to travel and have a lot of experience in doing so, as such, I place tremendous value on a smooth experience. I hope that anyone who chooses to reserve the space finds a comfortable and stress free experience.

name: HarvardMIT,InmanSq,clean,sunny apt.
space: The Airbnb apartment is on the second floor of our 2 family house. We are in Inman Square which is near Harvard and MIT with plenty of public transportation. Walking distance to more than 26 restaurants. 1880 working class house, freshly painted rooms and refinished hardwood floors. Large deck. Washer, dryer, full bath, microwave, stove. It is a small apartment suitable for 2 people, although it can accommodate 3 people. Full kitchen, bath and laundry.  There is one bed in the small bedroom and one sofa bed (IKEA pull out) in the living room immediately outside the bedroom. Both beds are "full" mattresses 54" x 78" (137cm x 198cm).  There are lots of good, international restaurants (Indian, Chinese, Korean-Thai, Mexican, Portuguese, Brazilian, Turkish, Southern, seafood, bars and grills, pubs and shops. Two grocery stores 10 minutes walk including Whole Foods. We are next to a city truck yard with occasional noise and consistently trucks work from 6:45-9 am. This is a quiet street most

name: Designer Flat on Conservation Land
space: Please read the entire listing before contacting us with questions! They are likely answered here. Recently renovated and beautifully furnished apartment abuts conservation land. host_about:
ABOUT US:

SeamlessTransition is a full-service relocation management agency that also offers quality short-term housing solutions.

SeamlessTransition offers short-term housing options to executives, medical professionals and leisure travelers looking to secure transitional housing in major cities throughout the United States. 

Whether you are relocating by yourself or with your family, SeamlessTransition has spacious, fully furnished apartment homes to suit your needs. We match an individual's or family's short-term housing needs and preferences with available and compatible housing inventory.

Our goal is to find the best short-term accommodations at the best price in the best location to meet your housing needs and preferences.  

The more information you provide us about your housing needs and preferences the easier it will be for us to find housing that will meet your needs and specifications.

We are available Monday through Friday, 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM (EST).
Our Reservation Center closes at 3:00 PM on Friday and will not reopen until Monday morning at 9:00 AM.

We observe all US Federal Holidays.  Kindly excuse our delay in response.

It would be our pleasure to serve you.

name: HARVARD/TUFTS: SHEA ROAD 1st FL Apt+PARKING PERMIT
summary: OUR PRIVATE, COZY VICTORIAN w/5 ROOMS (2 BEDROOMS) IS IDEAL SHORT-TERM FOR 1-7 GUESTS. PLEASE TELL:  -Your Full Names? -About Yourselves? -Time of Arrival AND -Departure? -Reason For Visit? notes: TO FIND THE CURRENT RATE for our apartment: Put in arrival and departure dates and total number of guests (adults and children). LOWEST RATE GUARANTEE:  Rates for my Entire 5 Room / 2 Bedroom Guest Apt depend on time of year and total number of guests and if they have any additional special requests  that might incur a small additional fee (ie. early or late check in, late check out, etc).  However, my apt is guaranteed to be no higher than the cheapest currently available  single hotel room on Expedia that has a Cambridge address!  (* see below for info).   - RATES, AVAILABILITY and AMENITIES ARE LIKELY TO CHANGE UNTIL A RESERVATION IS FINALIZED. RATES ARE LIKELY TO INCREASE IF ANY CHANGES ARE MADE TO AN EXISTING RESERVATION, AND WILL DEPEND ON TIME OF YEAR, TOTAL NUMBER OF GUESTS, ANY SPECIAL ADDITIONAL NEEDS, AND WHO IS THE BEST FIT and FINALIZES THEIR RESERVATION MOST QUICKLY.   - COST FOR OUR PRIVATE 5 ROOM / 2 BEDROOM GUEST APT IS GUARANTEED TO BE THE SAME OR CHEAPER THAN THE LOW
transit: PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IS ONLY 1/2 BLOCK WALK FROM THE APARTMENT (WHICH IS LOCATED ON SHEA ROAD) to MASS AVE BUS 79, and 2 1/2 BLOCK WALK to Davis Square T Red Line Subway Metro!
access: You have full access to our entire 5 room (2 bedroom) apartment with a fully equipped kitchen (We only request that you please: -do not use our fine china in the china cabinet, -put everything back cleaned after use, -don't use our dishwasher or washing machine or dryer as they are not set up for guest use, and that you -ignore our back kitchen doors as they lead to our apartment.)
interaction: We love hosting extended family and new friends, and are happy to share info on area restaurants, sights, universities, medicine, business, and biotech. Please email me 24/7 regarding any request or if something doesn't seem to work, and I'll try to reply as soon as I can get online. If time permits, I may even be able to give you an exclusive private tour of Harvard as I am a long-time advisor there and my children and husband are alums.
house_rules: No unregistered guests or (non-paying) visitors allowed at anytime. Each individual must be included in your official online Airbnb reservation guest count. PLEASE READ ALL INFO, ANSWER ALL THE PRE-BOOKING QUESTIONS BEFORE SUBMITTING YOUR RESERVATION REQUEST, and NOTE: -We will do everything possible to make your stay in our home comfortable, BUT if you are fussy, want a fancy vacation accommodations, OR need luxury with tons of storage space, please reserve an expensive hotel.  -Also, please be ready (after you receive your online "upcoming trip itinerary" from Airbnb) to review the "house manual" and answer pre-arrival questions to reconfirm all your info and to register each guest by providing their full contact info.  -If you are not willing to share each guest's details because you may feel it's too much, we understand but will not be able to host you, finalize logistics, nor arrange for you to get the keys for security purposes.  Thanks and hope to have you as our guests, Ama   -

host_about: Our family background is in medicine, venture capital, academia, digital heath, oceanography, and high tech. As world travelers, educated at Yale, Harvard, Columbia, & UCDavis, we seek out fun adventures, spending time with great family and friends, and good music and food. If you are like us and friendly, we'd love to share our home and welcome you into our extended Ivy family.

name: #34-3 Huge Room in Porter Square!!
summary: Just one mile from Harvard Square, located on the third floor of a quiet street in a Victorian house, this big beautiful room has a queen sized bed, a private bathroom and kitchenette. It's a fantastic room for students and/or tourists who want a quiet place to rest after a long day!
space: Welcome! The room is on the 3rd floor of an older victorian home (stairs, no elevator). It is very large and furnished with a comfortable queen tempurpedic bed, a large desk and a love-seat. You will have a private full bathroom (adjacent to the room). On occasion we allow guests to access other parts of the house but you MUST ask, and receive a positive response, to do so. It is the primary residence of the owners of the house who value their privacy.  Your entrance and exit to the room is on the other side of the split house and is shared with other tenants on that side of the building.  Cambridge is an wonderful town with lots to see and explore. Our house is located 0.3 miles (around a 7 minute walk)from the Porter Square Train Station (on the Red Line which goes, among other places, right into the popular Harvard Square in Cambridge, MA and Park Street in Boston) and is close to lots of shops and restaurants.

Some bike stores in the area offer bike rentals on a daily, weekly or monthly basis; Cambridge, MA is very bike friendly!
access: Separate entrance, their room, private bathroom, kitchenette (mini-fridge, microwave, water kettle)
house_rules: Please make sure to not make too much noise, especially at night; thanks!! :) Absolutely NO SMOKING whatsoever (not out the window, front porch, etc.). Please make sure to leave the room clean & tidy when you check out. Not doing so may be grounds to withhold part or all of your security deposit; thanks!! :)

host_about:
Welcome to The Cambridge Karma House!

¡Bienvenidos a La Casa de Karma!

We wanted a name that embodies our feelings and philosophy around hosting, and essentially it is about karma- the notion that our actions and intentions will come back to us and influence our future, whether they be positive or negative. Karma is similar to the golden rule of “treat others the way you want to be treated." We believe that this is a good way to go through the world and attempt to always practice this with our guests. We will try to always treat you with loving kindness and respect, and we expect the same from our guests--that they treat the folks running the house, other guests in the house, and the space itself, with respect and kindness.

This Victorian house built in the 1880s and still has many of the quirks from that era. Around 30 years ago our family bought the property, and in 2013 we started managing and renovating its 6 apartments and established the Cambridge Karma House LLC!

We enjoy hosting our guests & we look forward to meeting you! Please let us know if you need anything or have questions.

We try to always be friendly and caring to our guests so please do let us know if there's anything we can do to make your stay more comfortable.

CHECK-IN=any time after 3pm*

CHECK-OUT=12 noon or earlier*

*if you need to check in before 3pm or check out after 12 noon, please let us know and we will *try* to accommodate you (you MUST receive a confirmation that this is okay). If we’re not able to accommodate you with an early check-in or late check-out time, we are almost always able to offer our guests the ability to store their luggage in the basement during non-apartment-stay hours.

---> The details of our check-in and check-out procedures are *automatically* emailed to confirmed guests by airbnb through our “House Manual”; the House Manual covers a variety of topics but we ask that you ****privilege what is written here**** regarding parking, plumbing, tidiness + cleanliness, and waste disposal (we are in the process of updating the House Manuals on all of our listings but sometimes our systems, etc. change this places is the quickest go-to place to relay/outline what we need our guests to know and/or do). 

IMPORTANT NOTES (parking, plumbing, tidiness + cleanliness, and waste disposal)*:

*Please privilege guest expectations and procedures written here over those received in the "House Manual”

**************PARKING**************:

We canNOT offer parking to most of our guests. We have 1 visitors parking pass for 6 units (maximum 3 days in a row in the zone indicated behind the pass (to be placed on the dashboard) & the vehicle must be moved every 24 hours); if you want the pass YOU MUST ASK us *****AND**** receive a message confirming that, indeed, you may use it (it is in high demand and often unavailable).

Due to the limited availability of parking in Cambridge (both through the house and in Cambridge overall), we suggest you not bring a car.

**************PLUMBING**************

While there are many fantastic and charming features of the old Victorian house, the old pipes are not one of them! Therefore:

YOU ***MUST*** USE THE HAIR AND FOOD CATCHERS IN ALL OF THE DRAINS. Indeed, WATER (/polarity bonded liquids (no oil)) IS THE ONLY THING THAT CAN GO DOWN THE SINKS AND TUB. Not doing so will clog up the pipes; if we need to call the plumber we may keep part, all of your security deposit to remedy the situation.

**************TIDINESS & CLEANLINESS of Your Living Space When Checking Out**************

There is a short window period between checking-in and checking-out and oftentimes we are booked back to back with multiple apartments to prepare. If your apartment takes more than about an hour to clean it is likely we will draw from your deposit for this extra service of your apartment requiring a deep cleaning after you check out. Crumbs and food all over the tables and counters (or food in the trash; see below under "Compost"!), spilled products on the bathroom sink, this is not what we expect to encounter to turn around the apartment to the next guest. The apartments are large and wiping all the surfaces down, cleaning the floors and changing the bedding and towels in the most basic way usually takes about an hour. In a way we're trying to clean invisible things (germs, finger prints, dust, etc.) form one guest to the next; when we clean and prepare apartments we do not expect to have to pick-up-after-you.

A my j**************WASTE DISPOSAL: COMPOSTING + RECYCLING + TRASH************** :

Our Earth is under seriously strained circumstances in terms of how much toxic matter humans are exposing it to, and as such, we take waste production seriously. The best sustainable practice mantra is (in this order): reduce, reuse, recycle.

GUESTS STAYING UNDER ONE WEEK:

Please leave your trash, recyclables and compost INSIDE of the apartment and KINDLY DO NOT take it outside. If you need to take it out for some reason, please see the “where" section for each type of waste.

GUESTS STAYING OVER ONE WEEK:

Take your trash, recyclables and compost to the 19 side of the house and put them IN THE PROPER BINS (if you are unable to do so for medical reasons, please let us know and we will gladly do this for you!). The trash and recycling is collected at around 7am Wednesday morning (one day later on weeks where there are national holidays);

********TRASH********

WHAT? anything that is NOT compostable (food) or recyclable (paper, glass, aluminum, plastic). Examples: styrofoam, dirt and hair (though these last 2 can put in the garden)….most (clean) materials can be recycled! :-)

WHERE? Indoors: in the bin marked “Trash.” Outdoors: in the BLACK OR GREY bins (these are smaller than the recycling bins).

HOW? In TIGHTLY SEALED PLASTIC BAGS. You CANNOT leave the bags unsealed (this disrespects the folks collecting the trash by risking waste falling out while disposing of it) and/or the City will reject the bin likely fine us (and we will have no qualms about passing this on to you (by withholding your security deposit).

********RECYCLING********

WHAT?

Paper (example: receipts, newspaper, tissues, cereal boxes)

Glass (for example:bottles),

Aluminum (for example:cans)

Hard Plastics (for example: your clean (see below) yoghurt containers, to-go food containers, etc.….*****You must KEEP SOFT PLASTICS (for example: plastic bags) SEPARATE from other recyclable materials*****; these clog the recycling sorting machine. We put these together outside (either in a small bin by the compost wheel and/or in a large bag full of soft plastics (mostly bags)!

** VERY IMPORTANT NOTE: all materials MUST BE CLEAN. This means that you have to rinse out you milk cartons, clean out containers containing food (put excess food in the compost (**NEVER down the sink drain**; see “Plumbing”).

WHERE?

Indoors: in the bin marked “Recycling.”

Outdoors: in the LARGE NAVY BLUE BINS (everything goes in there EXCEPT for your soft plastics (for example: plastic bags); put these in the small container by the compost wheel or in a large plastic bag full of soft plastics).

vHOW?

WI
********COMPOST********

I N sA Isis WHAT?

IAll of your food scraps (for example: fruits peels, tea bags, coffee grinds, vegetable scraps, etc.) EXCEPT for meat and dairy (egg shells are fine!). What do do with these food caught in the kitchen sink? Throw it in the zip lock bag in the freezer :)

name: Sunny & Stylish 2BR in Cambridge
summary: Large and sunny two bedroom in Cambridgeport with back porch overlooking tranquil neighborhood, minutes away from hip Central Square and a single T-stop to Harvard and MIT.  Vintage + modern designs in the apartment.  Full of books.
space: Beautiful sun drenched two-bedroom, one-bathroom apartment occupying the entire second floor of its building, with a large north-facing private deck and sunny south-facing master bedroom with high ceilings, just three blocks from Central Square and a 10 minute stroll to the Charles River. This apartment has both northern and southern exposures and is flooded with natural light all day long. Located in a tranquil and peaceful part of Central Square. Preference for no more that two guests. There are several large plants that will need your watering. The apartment has full laundry with a washer and dryer.  Central heating.  On the private outdoor deck, lit with  strands of white lights, you can barbecue with the gas grill.  The apartment can comfortably sleep three people with its queen-size bed, full-size bed and large couch.  It has a fully equipped kitchen and a dining table. Master Bedroom: Queen size bed. Luxury linens, down duvet and pillows, and towels provided.  Bedroom contains t

space: ** Please note there has been some confusion lately regarding our exact address. Guests are advised to double check our address when using Map programs, Uber, Lyft or other means to locate us. Thanks! ** Please also be aware that the house you are booking is an old house. Alissa is staying in California permanently now and I'm Adam and I'm taking over hosting at Fiske Place. I like to read a lot and I'm into politics and herbal medicine. I've traveled quite a bit all over the world and I like talking to people and hearing their stories. I studied English literature in school and I know a little bit of science.

name: Harvard / Central Square : b1
summary: 1 bedroom with a Queen size bed can sleep 2.  Features a fully stocked kitchen (microwave, coffee maker, toaster, cookware, etc.), A/C, Heat, the Internet are all provided.  Washer/Dryer in unit Parking is available upon request when booking
space: Set in the historic center of Cambridge, this airy, modern apartment is perfect for friends and family looking to explore Harvard and Central square or any of the surrounding areas in Greater Boston. It's only a brisk 10-minute stroll to Harvard square, a 5-minute walk to Charles River, and a 10-minute walk to Central Square (MBTA subway access). The Central Square train stop is just 3 stops away from Downtown Boston.  The car is not necessary for transport within the city. https://www.airbnb.com/locations/boston Parking is available upon request when booking Minimum 3 days stay excluded special events Higher rates apply during Graduations, Head of the Charles Regatta, Holidays ...... There is a $60 cleaning fee Nearest Airport: Logan International Airport at 8 Miles Nearest Ferry: Charlestown Navy Yard at 3.7 Miles Nearest Train: Central Square MBTA at 0.5 Miles Nearest Motorway: I-93 at 2 Miles Nearest Beach: Magazine Beach at 0.8 Miles Nearest Barpub: The Plough & Stars at 0.2 Miles

name: Quiet Cambridge Apartment with Bikes Available
space: Starting at $200 a Night for up to four Guests  Our quiet apartment is located on one of the more beautiful tree lined residential streets in No. Cambridge. It’s a 1/3 mile walk to both the Davis Square and Alewife T Stations and two blocks from the bus into Harvard Square, allowing easy access to Cambridge and Boston.   - Totally renovated in 2011.   -In bedroom there is a queen sized bed. -Livingroom has an American Leather ( (Website hidden by Airbnb) sleeper sofa with a Tempur-Pedic Gel queen size mattress.  Hands down the most comfortable sleeper sofa on the market!  There is a light blocking curtain separating the living room and kitchen for privacy if sleeping in the living room. - Very large kitchen equipped with a gas stove, refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, hot water kettle, plates, glasses, utensils, pots and pans.  Tea, coffee and other treats are provided. - Bathroom is bright and clean with new fixtures and tiles.  Shampoo, Condition & soap provi

neighborhood_overview: Our street is a beautiful quiet tree lined street that does not get a lot of car traffic since it is not a through street from major roads.  There are several parks close by- a large one that is great for jogging, soccer, softball, track and smaller ones that with newly renovated playground equipment and water features for hot days.
transit: We have several bikes that are available for rent ($15 day) with locks and helmets.  Three bikes will fit riders who are 5'4"-5'10" and two for a taller ride 5'11-6'5".  Please let us know in advance if you are interested in renting them. We are a 12 minute walk from Alewife and Davis Square T station (subway) on the Red Line.  There are two bus routes that are down the street (2-3 mintute walk) that will take you to Harvard Sq and then you can transfer to other parts of town.
access: -coin operated washer/dryer available in the common basement area ($1 a load) -trampoline (with owners permission)
interaction: Andy and Kate are available to ask questions about restaurants, shopping, fun sights etc. while you are around.  Feel free to call or text them with questions.
house_rules: House Rules: - No smoking in the house.  - No pets.  - Street parking is available with a visitor pass. If the visitor pass is lost or not returned, there will be a $75 deduction from the security deposit.

host_about: My husband and I bought this house 25 years ago and have renovated almost every square inch of over the 25 year period.  We have two daughters who have graduated college (Colorado College & Princeton) and we have a 20-year-old son who is a sophomore at Harvard.  We all love cycling, rowing, baseball, the red sox and being with friends and family.

name: Perfect Studio Camb/Harvard Sq #2
summary: Second floor 2 room studio with full kitchen, dining and sleeping. Comfortable layout with lots of windows. Light darkening curtains ensure a good sleep. Exterior door in this apt eliminates the walk through building. Full size bath/tub. Please take a look at the "guest resources" available once you have a confirmed information regarding checking in and combo's necessary for entry . Also available directions from airport and hints about the neighborhood .
space: Second floor with full kitchen with dining area, bath and living room/bedroom. The apartment is furnished with all you will need ,linens and an extra set, kitchen implements ,small appliances,toaster oven ,microwave,coffee maker, stereo and though you cant see it a Samsung 32" LCD TV.. Bathroom with full sized tub for soaking after a long day on your feet.  Davis Sq is a short 7 min walk to the subway and a bustling nightlife, shops and tons of restaurants. Despite it's proximity the area is restful and quiet .

neighborhood_overview: Pemberton's Market around the corner is a wonderful place for grocery and prepared food. At the other end there is McKinnons market for great meat and produce. For a full grocery Star Market is just 12 min. Away in the Porter Sq. Exchange . The Somerville Theatre and Johnny D's offer concerts and films. Many restaurants abound the square falafel palace to gourmet Italian. The Somerville Community Bike Path also runs through Davis and brings you to the Minuteman Bikeway, which is perfect for an afternoon ride or jog. The consignment and vintage shops are some of the finest in the city, including Buffalo Exchange, Artifaktori and a very decent-sized Goodwill. Redbones, arguably the best BBQ in the Boston area. Oh and the coffee - you can spend hours and hundreds of dollars on strong-brewed coffee at Diesel Cafe,Starbucks or Dunkin Donuts all just steps away. Try Dave's pasta in Davis for a great sandwich!      DAVIS SQ. There are actually too many things to tell you. So I will tell you w
notes: Note that the shower valve spins all the way in a circle for hot or cold . If your not getting the desired temperature turn dial clockwise or counter . Very limited parking check for availability .City no longer offers visitor permits to me .
transit: Directions from Airport - Free ride take the Silver line to South Station (red line) get off at Davis Sq. it's a .3 mile walk across the square.There is some construction blocking Chester St so avoid this take Elm St from station to Day St to left on Cottage right on Chester St . Last block before end of road on left .    Just 2 blocks/4 min from Davis Square, Somerville.  There's a metro station (Red Line)and a brand new bike hub for  Boston's the hubway city bikes available 3 seasons .Proximity to Boston and Harvard Sq. cant be beat . Jump on a bus that runs every 10 min. To Harvard Sq. or walk the mile along Mass. Ave lined with cute boutique stores.
access: Guests have a private entrance or main hall entry. Coin-op laundry
interaction: I do not live at this property but am available by phone, text or email. I'm not far away should you have questions, concerns or problems and can physically be there quickly.
house_rules: • Check-in time is 3PM till midnight  Check out is 10am ,Please ask beforehand if you'd to stay later if there is not another guest arriving that day I can accommodate. ~ No smoking allowed in or around property. ~ Wifi is provided . ~ Please set thermostat for when your away or sleeping:  For winter months -There 4 different times: wake- leave- return- sleep. Push “set" and use arrows up and down to adjust time or temp. -Upon departure leave heat at 55 degrees during extreme cold below freezing .Set temp. and “hold"  ~ Leave AC off at departure . Thank you !

space: Set in the historic center of Cambridge, this airy, modern apartment is perfect for friends and family looking to explore Harvard and Central square or any of the surrounding areas in Greater Boston. It's only a brisk 10 minute stroll to Harvard square, a 5 minute walk to Charles River, and a 10 minute walk to Central Square (MBTA subway access). The Central Square train stop is just 3 stops away from Downtown Boston.  The car is not necessary for transport within the city. https://www.airbnb.com/locations/boston 1 bedroom with a Queen size bed can sleep 2 and sofa bed.  The Bar counter with (microwave, coffee maker and toaster) A/C, Heat, Internet are all provided.  No kitchen. Parking is available upon request when booking Minimum 3 days stay excluded special events Higher rates apply during Graduations, Head of the Charles Regatta, Holidays ...... name: See Yourself in Central Square
space: Welcome to our Central Square Apartment, right in the heart of downtown Cambridge! Steps away from the Red Line, we are located right in between  Harvard and MIT! Our Second Floor walk up is a studio apartment with King sized bed, full sized futon couch and sun filled atrium complete with hammock.  It has a full bath and a well stocked kitchen.  A former seamstress's shop in the seventies, it has floor to ceiling mirrors that gives the space an even larger feel.  It still retains some of that funky seventies charm. Though right in the heart of downtown Cambridge, the apartment is set back from the street so it is surprisingly quiet. An oasis from the city sounds, the apartment shares the 4 story building with office space so evenings are very quiet and private. The Green Street parking garage is located across the street and charges $13 a day.  Pearl Street laundromat is two blocks away.  Central Square is the hub of Cambridge.  Right out the front door you are greeted by a Tibetan res

host_about:
I spent most of my adult life traveling around the globe from my home base in Portland,Oregon... sometimes staying in people's house, sometimes just a hammock between two trees.  I am currently indoctrinating my son to like these things so we can hit the road when he gets a wee bit older.  My last trip was across India by bicycle.  Good fun if you get the chance!

Since I've been in Cambridge, I've learned things that would be not possible while traveling, learning the guitar, making beer, perfecting my jerk chicken burritos...and I've grown to love this town...lively music scene, and the biking is getting better and better!

name: Oversized Room - Condo Cambridge
space: The condo of 1200 square feet is recently renovated and elegantly furnished. The photos do not do justice to this sun-filled and well -organized condo. This over-sized bedroom is the biggest among the three bedrooms for rent. The room is nicely furnished with desk, queen size bed, nightstand, dresser, and closet.  blankets and clean sheets are available during checkin. One common bathroom. working professional living in New York. recently relocated to Singapore for one year maybe two Chinese-American. Enjoy traveling, reading books, classic music, cooking and sports. I am a big fan of Airbnb. I open my home to welcome guests from all around the world. 
So I welcome you to Boston and New York. Hope our paths will cross some day.

The condo is in a brown stone building minutes from Harvard Square making it easy to explore Boston and Cambridge.  Fully equipped kitchen, high speed internet, strong heating and water pressure, wooden flooring, tiled bathroom, laundry in the building and ample closet space. The whole unit has just been renovated and redecorated in December so everything is squeaky new. The unit is located adjacent to the Cambridge Commons and is a 4 minute walk to the Harvard Square Red Line and a 10 minute walk to the Porter Square Red Line.  There is also bus station a minute away that will take you directly to locations like the Belmont, Watertown, North End, Harvard Sq, Quincy Market, Copley Sq, Public Gardens, Symphony Hall, and Museum of Fine Arts and Longwood Medical Center. FOR NEW airbnb user, below are some of the FAQ links for your perusal (questions & answers useful for new user). Please do let me know if you have any problem, my response would be faster than airbnb support team as sometimes their hotline as very busy (but I only can help you on general question).

GENERAL FAQ for guests before booking
www.airbnb.com/help/topic/traveling

FAQ: What are Airbnb Service Fees?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/104

FAQ: For How to Book
www.airbnb.com/help/question/85

FAQ: For How to make a payment / reservation
Please message me first before you book with the number of guests including kids. Tax of 13% is added on to the total and sent. 

FAQ: For How to Contact Airbnb Support
www.airbnb.com/help/question/9

FAQ: How and when do I make a payment for my reservation?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/92

FAQ: How can I view or print a billing receipt or itinerary for my trip?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/100

FAQ: How are cleaning fees added?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/58

FAQ: How does the Airbnb payment system work?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/51

Contact Number and Email Information will only be released until a booking is made.

Below is the FAQ on airbnb “Why can’t I call or email a host before booking?”: www.airbnb.com/help/question/111

We strongly recommend reviewing all cancellation policies before making your reservations: www.airbnb.com/home/cancellation_policies

Hope this helps you get to know how airbnb works :-)

For Pricing, at the listing page, enter check in date, check out date and total number of guests. The system will auto generate the price for your consideration. Regarding the currency display, it depends on your own setting, you can change your currency setting at the lower left panel of your airbnb page under the "LANGUAGE", you will see "CURRENCY" setting. Just click on it to change to any currency that you wish to display.

- Return Customer or Host or Guest with positive reviews with whatever possible discount on top of their daily / weekly / month rate OR VIP customer that keep booking over certain accumulated nights that I will offer extra discount OR Customer who had referred me many booking :-)

summary: Clean, quiet and comfortable Airbnb private bedroom has several amenities - HDTV, internet, and iron. Watch Amazon movies at no extra charge.  It comfortably sleeps two and located on a quiet dead end street. 10 min ride to Harvard Square, Cambridge.

neighborhood_overview: I am conveniently located on a quiet tree-lined dead end street. The neighborhood hosts many friendly middle aged families with children.  In the spring and summer, seeing runners, bikers and people walking their dogs in the nearby path is common. If the weather is nice, the back yard and back porches are a great place to unwind. Only a 5 minute drive to Fresh Pond Shopping Center (Bertucci's, Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, Staples, TJ Maxx, Petsmart, Dunkin Donuts, Entertainment Cinemas (10 screens), and many more stores.
transit: Bus #77 Arlington Heights running to Harvard and Porter Squares is only a two minute walk around the corner on Massachusetts Avenue.  Walk another 15 minutes to catch the red line trains either at Davis Square or Alewife subway stops.  Local cabs usually arrive within 10 mins from calling.  All reservations include parking access in my driveway.  Please be sure to park closest to my house (right side) as the other side (left side) is reserved to my neighbors.
access: All Airbnb guests have full access to my apartment including the rear porches and backyard.  Feel free to use my kitchen and gas stove but please leave it clean.  Microwave and toaster oven access is also available.  My bathroom is shared between myself and the confirmed Airbnb guest(s) only.  My unit rarely has multiple Airbnb guest reservations per night but occasionally I do host multiple guests in another room (not pictured online). 95% of the time I host only one Airbnb reservation.  Please ask if this is a concern. All confirmed reservations have access to my driveway parking spot for one car.    My Airbnb room is always private with a door lock and key.  The shared spaces include the bathroom and kitchen.  My living room is currently my office space.
interaction: I provide a brief tour of my unit to all my Airbnb guests to familiarize them to there Airbnb room and my place.  I give an overview of the Cambridge and Boston area, public transportation system and places of interest (if needed).  I'm always available to my guests either in person or via text message.  I prefer if guests come to me with questions but otherwise let them enjoy their time in my place with minimal to moderate interaction. Most often, I interact with guests in the evening once the busy day has passed. I am always present during a guests stay.  There are times when I am away leaving the guest by themselves for a night or two but this is rare.
house_rules: -- No driveway parking ANYWHERE, street parking ONLY -- Check in MUST be between 7pm - 11pm convenient to your schedule -- Turn off ALL lights and equipment (AC, HDTV, pedestal fan, space heater) upon unit exit -- No smoking in the unit (smoking on the back porch ONLY is fine) -- No burning of candles anytime -- No shoes in the unit at all times; you may wish to bring slippers -- Place supplied bathmat at foot of shower -- MUST be clean and orderly in common areas -- Use of any dishes and/or utensils MUST be cleaned immediately after each use -- No sticking or hanging of ANY items on the walls -- No guests except those registered via Airbnb

host_about:
I am an IT Professional and part time student at Harvard University.  I'm originally from Cambridge and know the city well.  I'm more than happy to offer interesting places to visit or best ways of traveling in and around Cambridge/Boston.

I enjoy good conversation, am friendly, and open to different perspectives in life.

Two of the places I enjoyed most traveling to were Japan and the Dominican Republic for there beaches, culture, and warm weather.

name: Suite Central B&B in the Heart of Cambridge
summary: Lovely, cozy suite: your own entrance, bedroom (double bed), living room (with fold-out sofa), private bathroom, foyer.  Located centrally near Harvard, MIT, transit, restaurants, coffee shops, museums...  PLEASE RESERVE CORRECTLY:  More than 1 person = extra $20/night each
space: We are happy to offer you a cozy, private suite in our single-family home on a quiet, safe, one-way street. We can accommodate 2 adults; and we have a fold-out sofa for children (no charge for children under 13 years). We provide breakfast at no extra charge: coffee, yogurt, bagels, fruit, and more. (Tea and hot chocolate are available in the suite at all times.) Centrally located near Harvard, MIT, Lesley University -- and a 5- to 15-minute walk to public transit, restaurants, coffee shops, museums, movies, music, plays, stores...  Our house is the perfect place to stay if you're coming to the area for interviews, graduation, parents' weekend, conferences, business -- or just vacation! Your suite has its own entrance; a bedroom with a double bed, your own living room, and a private bathroom. There is also a double-bed fold-out sofa in your living room. WE ARE VERY CLOSE TO PUBLIC TRANSIT AND:  **Cambridge: We are minutes from Cambridge's major squares: with restaurants, coffee shops,

neighborhood_overview: Restaurants! library! movies! coffee shops! book stores! grocery stores! public transportation (bus and subway)!  a shopping mall and other retail . . . Cambridge is very biking-friendly and walking-friendly. You can easily and safely walk/jog around our neighborhood and throughout Cambridge, or over the bridge into Boston --
notes: We do live in the house, but we know that you want privacy and the suite is perfect for that. With your own entrance, bathroom, living room, and so on, you essentially have the house to yourself. On the other hand, you should feel free to come ask us questions or have conversation, to eat breakfast in the kitchen, and so on.
transit: Buses at the end of our block go to Harvard Square, Kendall Square (MIT), and Central Square.  Both Kendall Square and Central Square have subway lines and buses into Boston. We are a 5-minute walk to Central Square and to Inman Square; and a 15-minute walk to Harvard, to MIT, to Kendall Sq., and to the Longfellow Bridge into Boston.
access: Guests have their own private bathroom, living room, bedroom, and entrance (and key).  WiFi is provided, as well as a desktop computer; we can provide printing if you need it. The suite has a TV (not cable). We provide, in the suite, an electric tea kettle and a small refrigerator.
interaction: CHECK-IN: When do you want to check in? We're very flexible. Please email us ahead of time for what time you would like to check in. PARKING: please let us know ahead of time if you have a car, so we can open up our driveway for you.
house_rules: 1. Sorry, no smoking on the property. 2. We prefer that you not wear their shoes in the house, but it's NOT a rule :). 3. We make the beds up only after each visit. Fresh towels are provided. 4. Let us know beforehand if you have any food or other allergies. 5. ENERGY: We are very energy-conscious, and ask that you turn off lights and other energy-using items when you leave the house each day.
