host_about:
Dave is a recently retired welder, and now works with a local union and in a local soup kitchen; Leslie is a freelance editor, and a former attorney and teacher, and she volunteers as an ESL teacher. 
"We're eager to help you find your way around Cambridge and Boston, and look forward to having you as our guests!"

name: Home on quiet street near Harvard
space: Second-floor room adjacent to bathroom and kitchen shared with owner. Walk up one flight from porch. Fifteen-minute walk to Harvard Square. Ten-minute walk to Harvard Yard. Five-minute walk to Harvard Law School. Room contains double bed, closet, desk, Wireless access, and basic TV. Linens provided ( sheets, bath towels, hand towels, etc.) In cold weather, guests have access to the thermostat and also small plug-in heater/fan. Room has AC  installed in window during summer.  Movable fans for other rooms. Simple breakfast supplies available in kitchen (coffee/tea, milk, juice, cereal, bagels, fruit, eggs).  Laundromat and cafe on corner of street.  Owner has no pets, but tenant in separate apartment on first floor has two cats.

host_about:
I have lived in my house in Cambridge for more than forty years, during which I have shared the space with family and first-floor tenants. Though my children are grown, I love my neighborhood and appreciate the sense of community.  I know well the advantages of this location, and I always enjoy connecting people with historic and cultural resources. In keeping with these enthusiasms, I volunteer as a guide at deCordova Sculpture Park and Museum in Lincoln and participate in projects at a community art center near my house.  I post about art in the Boston area on a blog called ART OUTDOORS. 
 (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

Currently a freelance writer and editor of educational materials, I keep a home office but still have one guest room that is not used often enough.  I think the room would prove to be a comfortable base for someone attending a conference or exploring the Boston area.

name: Charming Cottage in Central Square
space: Unique antique cottage is located in a quiet, safe neighborhood, yet just 2 blocks from Central Square Redline (subway).  It is conveniently located between MIT and Harvard (1 subway stop) and just a 2 block walk to many restaurants, clubs, markets and shops on Massachusetts Avenue.  A quick 10 minute walk will take you to the river and spectacular views of the Boston Skyline.  Cottage was built in 1815 and has a very cozy feel with low ceilings and plenty of light from southerly windows. Stairs leading up to bedroom are quite steep, typical of that time period but not ideal for those with limited mobility.  It is fully furnished and has a living room, eat in kitchen, pantry with washer/dryer, full bathroom, bedroom and study area.  Cottage is not fancy or luxurious but has new furnishings and can  make for a very comfortable visit.   It is tucked back from the street in a perennial filled yard shared with the house in front.  On-street Parking is available with a visitors pass (provid
description: Unique antique cottage is located in a quiet, safe neighborhood, yet just 2 blocks from Central Square Redline (subway).  It is conveniently located between MIT and Harvard (1 subway stop) and just a 2 block walk to many restaurants, clubs, markets and shops on Massachusetts Avenue.  A quick 10 minute walk will take you to the river and spectacular views of the Boston Skyline. On-street Parking is available with a visitors pass (provid
neighborhood_overview: The best thing about the neighborhood is that many people have been living there for 20+ years and everybody knows everybody.  Because it is a multigenerational neighborhood, someone is always around keeping an eye out. This keeps the neighborhood safe and friendly.  The second best thing is the proximity to everything.  The subway and center of Central Square is only 2 blocks away, yet the neighborhood remains surprisingly quiet.
transit: The subway and buses are only a 2 block walk away.  The subway is the Redline which is a central line and the best running of all the subway lines.  There are also buses that will take you to parts of the city and surrounding towns where the subway does not travel.  If you care to walk, Boston is only 15-20 mins with a beautiful walk across the Mass ave bridge and Charles River.  MIT is about a 10 min walk and Harvard is about 15 mins.  Driving is a challenge in Boston because the city is old and the streets go every which way.  I still get lost!
access: Guests have access to the yard which has an outdoor table and chairs, rocking bench and a grill.  They also have access to a locked shed on the property where they can store luggage if they need to check out due to another guests arrival but are not leaving town until later that day.
interaction: I live in Vermont, so sadly I don't have much interaction with the guests.  I do have neighbors that are available to help out if anything is needed or not functioning as expected.
house_rules: No smoking inside.
amenities: {Internet,Wifi,"Air conditioning",Kitchen,Heating,"Family/kid friendly",Washer,Dryer,Essentials,Shampoo,"Self check-in",Lockbox}
host_about:
I am a nutritionist living in Vermont with my family, 2 kids and 1 husband :-)
I used to live in Cambridge but traded city life for the country.  I still love going back for visits and staying in the cottage.  I also love the water, love to travel and love little dogs!

name: Cozy Sublet in Mid Cambridge MA!
summary: -Available Dec 1 for school term.  Enjoy the comfort & convenience of my cozy 1 bedroom, on a quiet street in Mid Cambridge. With lots of light, hardwood floors, french doors, a beautiful kitchen & 2 decks. Minutes to Harvard, MIT & public transportation.
space: Fully furnished, lots of windows and hardwood floors throughout, lovely front and back porches, landscaped garden & patio. 700 sq. ft. includes living room with study area & pull out sofa bed, bedroom with queen sized bed, window air conditioners, large closets and bathroom with tub. Large eat-in kitchen is fully equipped with brand new stainless steel appliances, microwave, dishwasher, disposal.

Mid- Cambridge is a beautiful neighborhood of Victorian houses and tree lined streets.   Convenient to everything - half way btween Harvard & Central Sqs. Enjoy ex
neighborhood_overview: Mid- Cambridge is a beautiful neighborhood of Victorian houses and tree lined streets.   Convenient to everything - half way btween Harvard & Central Sqs. Enjoy excellent dining, entertainment, site seeing & seasonal events. Everything you need is near by including grocery stores, library, post office, drug stores, cafes, banks, hubway bikes, Charles River.
notes: This property is available from June 20 - August 10th - OR- August - June for the full school term.
transit: Located half way between Harvard and Central Sq subway stops on the Red Line. The #1 bus runs up Mass Ave 2 blocks. The 69 bus to Lechmere Green line one block walk.
access: Fee includes all utilities, internet/cable & laundry included. Easy on-street parking.
interaction: I live down the block so you have any questions - just call or text, I will be happy to help.
house_rules: Available for Academic year or  Summer Session. Minimum 4 week stay. Letter of acceptance to University Program requested for confirmation. Occupancy for two people. No Smoking or pets. Shared laundry down stairs in basement used before 9 pm.

host_about: Hi, I am Melissa. I grew up in historic Lexington Mass and studied Art History and Art Education. I make sculpture out of recycled computer parts. I work out of a Maker Space called the Artisan's Asylum in Somerville and teach people of all ages. I also love to swim, hike, read, watch films, garden, shop and eat!  I put my heart and soul into renovating my condo and turned it into the dream home I always wanted! I love the back porch and back yard where I started a shade garden 3 years ago. It is the most relaxing place to hang out on a hot summer day! I rent to Harvard faculty during the school year and to short term visitors in the summer. Come visit MA. I live around the block and would be happy to give suggestions of what to see and do on your visit!

name: Room in a bright and colorful Cambridge home
summary: Furnished room in a beautiful 2-bedroom apartment. 10 minute walk to the Harvard sq. T stop on the red line or 12 min to Central sq.  Two blocks away from the #1 bus.  Right by the Charles River.  Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, and many coffee shops, bars and restaurants all within walking distance.
space: Quiet room with a queen-size bed in a 2-bedroom apartment. Large kitchen, living room, free laundry in the basement and street parking with our visitor permit.
description: Furnished room in a beautiful 2-bedroom apartment. 10 minute walk to the Harvard sq. T stop on the red line or 12 min to Central sq.  Two blocks away from the #1 bus.  Right by the Charles River.  Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, and many coffee shops, bars and restaurants all within walking distance. Quiet room with a queen-size bed in a 2-bedroom apartment. Large kitchen, living room, free laundry in the basement and street parking with our visitor permit. You'll will have access to all the common areas within the apartment as well as the backyard. We'll send you instructions on how to check in in case we're not home when you first arrive. My wife and I live in this apartment and we use one of the 2 bedrooms here.  We both have busy schedules and are often away on weekends. We're located right between Harvard Sq. and Central Sq. in Cambridge, just a couple of blocks from the Charles River. If you're driving, you can park anywhere on the street and we'll give you a visitor parking pass. You
neighborhood_overview: We're located right between Harvard Sq. and Central Sq. in Cambridge, just a couple of blocks from the Charles River.
notes: Our apartment is on the first floor of a big multi-family house, so you'll first walk through the entrance to the house, then walk a few steps further to get to the door to our place, walking past a staircase that leads up to the other apartments on the second and third floors of the house.
transit: If you're driving, you can park anywhere on the street and we'll give you a visitor parking pass. You can also take the #1 Bus that takes you across the bridge to Boston's Back Bay or South End areas, or hop on the Red Line T (we call our metro "T" here :) that can take you to downtown Boston in 3 or 4 stops.
access: You'll will have access to all the common areas within the apartment as well as the backyard. We'll send you instructions on how to check in in case we're not home when you first arrive.

host_about: I'm a friendly guy in my early thirties, always willing to meet new people and see new places.  I work with music and video and I live in Cambridge, USA, though whenever I get a chance, I like to go out and feed my curiosity for the world we all share and live in.

name: Great Apt. Harvard Sq.and Boston#1A
summary: Beautiful first floor 2 room studio with lots of architectural detail. Opens up to a large shared yard where lounge chairs and table  are for your use. Plenty of storage with a walk in closet off kitchen and built in cabinets either side of hall. Please take a look at the "guest resources" available once you have a confirmed information regarding checking in and combo's necessary for entry . Also available directions from airport and hints about the neighborhood .
space: Just 2 blocks/7 min from Davis Square(Red line subway) 1.3 miles from Harvard Square. Apartment is on the first floor spilling out the back from a small deck is a huge yard with table and chairs for your use. .Hardwood floors throughout with lots of windows. The apartment is furnished with all you will need direct line internet or wifi ,HD 40" flat screen TV with premiere channels and DVR you wont miss your favorite shows . There are plenty of linens ,towels, kitchen implements ,gas oven ,small appliances,toaster oven ,microwave,coffee maker . Window AC unit for the summer months.   Coin-op washer and dryer on premiss. Private entrance  make this a must see for those wishing to visit Cambridge or Boston.   Pemberton's Market around the corner is a wonderful place for grocery and prepared food. At the other end of Chester St.there is a new Fresh Market and McKinnons market for great meat and produce. For a full grocery Star Market is just 12 min. Away in the Porter Sq. Exchange . The So

neighborhood_overview: Pemberton's Market around the corner is a wonderful place for grocery and prepared food. At the other end there is McKinnons market for great meat and produce. For a full grocery Star Market is just 12 min. Away in the Porter Sq. Exchange . The Somerville Theatre and Johnny D's offer concerts and films. Many restaurants abound the square falafel palace to gourmet Italian. The Somerville Community Bike Path also runs through Davis and brings you to the Minuteman Bikeway, which is perfect for an afternoon ride or jog. The consignment and vintage shops are some of the finest in the city, including Buffalo Exchange, Artifaktori and a very decent-sized Goodwill. There's also When Pigs Fly artisan bread shop where you can sample till your hearts content .Next door Kickass Cupcakes a little bit outside of DavisSq. On Highland Ave. Redbones, arguably the best BBQ in the Boston area. Oh and the coffee - you can spend hours and hundreds of dollars on strong-brewed coffee at Diesel Cafe,Starbucks
notes: Note that the shower valve spins all the way in a circle for hot or cold . If your not getting the desired temperature turn dial clockwise or counter . Very limited parking check for availability .
transit: Directions from Airport - Free ride take the Silver line to South Station (red line) get off at Davis Sq. it's a .3 mile walk across the square.There is some construction blocking Chester St so avoid this take Elm St from station to Day St to left on Cottage right on Chester St . Last block before end of road on left .    Just 2 blocks/4 min from Davis Square, Somerville.  There's a metro station (Red Line)and a brand new bike hub for  Boston's the hubway city bikes available 3 seasons .Proximity to Boston and Harvard Sq. cant be beat . Jump on a bus that runs every 10 min. To Harvard Sq. or walk the mile along Mass. Ave lined with cute boutique stores.
access: The apartment has a full kitchen ,dining area , bedroom/livingroom and bath . There is laundryroom in basement . The backdoor opens up to a  deck and expansive back yard with patio chairs and table for your use in the summer monthes.
interaction: I do not live at this property but am available by phone, text or email. I'm not far away should you have questions, concerns or problems and can physically be there quickly.
house_rules: •Check-in time is 3PM till midnight.Check out is 10am if you'd like a later check-out ask beforehand if there isn't a guest arriving that day I can accommodate. -use front door and apt is at end of hall#1A . ~No smoking in or around the property. -turn off AC upon departure. ~Please set thermostat lower for when your away or sleeping. There 4 different times- wake- leave- return- sleep. Push “set" and use arrows up and down to adjust time or temp. Upon departure LEAVE TEMP AT 60 degrees ("hold" set to 60) during below freezing temps during the winter.

name: Private Room- Next door to train
summary: The apartment is on the first floor of a two family house right and within 100 yards of the train, a movie theater, coffee shops, bars, and restaurants, and live street performers. You cannot beat the location!!!!
space: The apartment is right in the heart of Davis square and within 100 yards of the train.  It is on the first floor of a two family house.  It is a GREAT neighborhood. I have coffee on my front porch every weekend over the summer and people watch. There is literally nowhere that I much rather live.    This is closer to a shor-term roommate situation than a typical Airbnb.  I don't have signs or a guestbook because it seems institutional to me.  Feel free to just open the cabinates.   The bedroom has a small closet, a desk, bureau, and a full size bed. I have a full kitchen and bathroom that has everything you will need. I provide sheets, towels, and basic toiletries.  Feel free to use anything in the bathroom. The apartment has high speed internet, central air conditioning, netflix, and basic cable. There is a coin operated washer/dryer in the basement.  The door is to the left of the fridge. Street parking isn't difficult.  I have visitor parking pass that will allow you to park on the s

neighborhood_overview: Great up and coming neighborhood. There are usually street performers in the center of the square. Somerville Theater (1st run movie theater and performance venue) Museum of Bad Art (Free with movie) Rockland Theater (performance art) Live Music- The Burren 4 +independent coffee shops (plus Starbucks and Dunkin' Donuts) Restaurants and bars Boutiques and shopping Nails and Spas
notes: This is closer to a roommate situation than a hotel or an investment Airbnb.  I am not a fan of having signs all over my apartment with rules.  I expect guests to be cool, which they always are.
transit: It is Next door to the Red line which will take you anywhere in Boston. There are also numerous zipcar locations.  Parking is a challenge and I suggest another Airbnb if you need parking.
access: Guests are free to take advantage of full use of the kitchen and common areas, play with the thermostat, and use the bbq area.  Feel free to open cabinets and drawers if you're looking for something.
interaction: I work from home and do stand up comedy at night about 5 days a week.    I hangout and take some guests to shows with me and don't even see other guests.   I try to feel people out and am happy either way or somewhere in the middle.   You just have to ask.   I go to the Burren every Wednesday at 10pm which is a free comedy show.
house_rules: *No cigarettes *Please leave the house in good condition. * This is closer to a roommate situation than a B&B or hotel.

I am an accountant and I do standup comedy at night/weekends.   It a fun, but busy life style.   I have had guests that I've only seen once at check in and guests that I've brought to shows with me and hung out with.

I also rent out the apartment when I am traveling for work.

name: Sunny, lg 1-br, heart of Cambridge
summary: ***Seeking a long-term tenant (6+ months) for a furnished, fully wired, plug and play one bedroom apartment.*** I love being curled up on the couch, with the morning sunlight pouring in, knowing that everything (groceries, gym, spin, yoga, bars, cafes, restaurants, public transport, etc.) is within a two block radius. The street is quiet, but the neighborhood lively; it's the best of both worlds -- true Cambridge.
space: Gorgeous top-floor, corner-apartment in the ideal Cambridge location! Eight minutes from Harvard Yard, 10 minutes from the Central Square T, and 7 minutes to the Charles River (all by foot!), it's a large and well-laid out one-bedroom - perfect for a couple. Enter through a mirror-lined foyer (not shown) into a spacious living room with incredible sunlight. Living room contains pass-through to a full kitchen -- perfect for entertaining small groups. The kitchen is fully equipped, including dishwasher/disposal and all modern appliances. The bedroom, a beautiful teal color with hard wood furniture, has a queen sized bed, matching dresser and nightstands, a large closet, and windows on two walls. Even the bathroom gets sunlight so bright that you feel like you're showering outside! Hardwood floors throughout (minus kitchen and bathroom). There are three closets in the apartment, significant dresser space, and free laundry and bike storage in the basement. There's a stop for the M1 bus on

name: Harvard Tufts MIT: Artist's Home
summary: Private bedroom in handsome, colorful, artist's house on quiet street. Parking.  Sunny kitchen. Centrally located walking distance to Porter, Davis, Harvard Sq, Tufts, retail districts. Minutes to Harvard, MIT, Boston via the T.
space: This private bedroom is painted in rich shades of red.  It's bright with two windows and is on the first floor of a stately, well-maintained three story house, built circa 1920, on a quiet, tree-lined street.  Parking available. The room is in our sunny, clean three-bedroom condominium with one bathroom (shared) and a private yard. It's air-conditioned and has a queen size bed with cotton sheets and a fluffy down comforter. Comfortable for a single person or a couple.  Your hosts include me and on occasion, my college aged son or another Airbnb guest, typically a grad student staying for a semester. Perfect for grad student or visiting professor.  We have 3 rooms available on Airbnb, so if this room is booked please inquire about the other 2. The room accommodates two: it has a queen sized bed. If you need two beds,  I could put a thick and comfortable futon on the floor for a second person. Given the size of the room, to walk around the bed you would need to step over the futon or, wh

neighborhood_overview: Quiet residential neighborhood with quick access to pubic transportation, cafes, restaurants, retail shops, entertainment, parks, Hubway bike rental, and walking and biking trails, local grocery stores, Whole Foods, Trader Joes, H Mart.
notes: Also we would like to note that the apartment has one additional bedroom available with a double bed. Roomy enough for 2.
transit: Great location for visiting Harvard, MIT, Lesley, Cambridge or Boston.  10-15 minute walk, or quicker bus ride, to Porter Square, Davis Square or Alewife Red Line Stations.  25 -30 minute walk, or quicker Red Line or bus, to Harvard Square. Easy access to public transportation and connect in minutes to all points in Cambridge and Boston, such as MIT, Mass General Hospital, and downtown's legal, financial, retail districts.  Very near Massachusetts Avenue and Cambridge/Boston's lively atmosphere, great retail shops, indie book stores and coffee shops, restaurants, museums, Whole Foods, Trader Joes, parks, walking/biking trails, Hubway bike rental.  We have a 3-Day street parking pass available for one guest.  Ask if it's available.  Access to Logan Airport via taxi or public transportation Silver Line to Red Line then 10-15 minute walk or 5 min bus ride.
access: Guests have access to the bedroom, the sunny, fully-equipped kitchen,  one shared bathroom (recently renovated), private backyard with lawn, flowers, table and chairs - large enough for a small game of croquet.   Enjoy the morning paper at the backyard table.
interaction: I'll meet with guests to answer any questions, show you the ropes.

host_about: I work in Boston and enjoy traveling and spending time with my two wonderful college age sons. Originally from the Midwest, I've lived in Cambridge over 30 years and, if you would like, I'll share travel tips and information about restaurants and classic New England places to visit in Cambridge and Boston, as well as where to find the secret bakery in Boston's "Little Italy" the North End or neighborhood live music venues.  I'm very comfortable with guests who like to come and go with little interaction or those who want to interact with a "native".

host_about:
Friendly, smart, politically liberal/progressive, resourceful :) I love hosting people from all over the world, and know the Cambridge/Boston area well (for a native NY'er---I've been here since graduate school which was 20 yrs ago). You will find the environment here 'on the court' restful, peaceful and as my current guest from Australia put it, "I  figured you were a healer of some sort-- because your home feels healing." Our place is relaxing and down to earth, with  an artistic and colorful ambiance, and lots of sunlight.

My boy is pure enjoyment once he feels comfortable with a guest. My dog is one of the sweetest mutts ever (objectively speaking of course)!

If you happen to be taking the bus from NYC, WORLD WIDE BUS leaves you a 10 minute walk from our house.

host_about:
Welcome to The Cambridge Karma House!

¡Bienvenidos a La Casa de Karma!

We wanted a name that embodies our feelings and philosophy around hosting, and essentially it is about karma- the notion that our actions and intentions will come back to us and influence our future, whether they be positive or negative. Karma is similar to the golden rule of “treat others the way you want to be treated." We believe that this is a good way to go through the world and attempt to always practice this with our guests. We will try to always treat you with loving kindness and respect, and we expect the same from our guests--that they treat the folks running the house, other guests in the house, and the space itself, with respect and kindness.

This Victorian house built in the 1880s and still has many of the quirks from that era. Around 30 years ago our family bought the property, and in 2013 we started managing and renovating its 6 apartments and established the Cambridge Karma House LLC!

We enjoy hosting our guests & we look forward to meeting you! Please let us know if you need anything or have questions.

We try to always be friendly and caring to our guests so please do let us know if there's anything we can do to make your stay more comfortable.

CHECK-IN=any time after 3pm*

CHECK-OUT=12 noon or earlier*

*if you need to check in before 3pm or check out after 12 noon, please let us know and we will *try* to accommodate you (you MUST receive a confirmation that this is okay). If we’re not able to accommodate you with an early check-in or late check-out time, we are almost always able to offer our guests the ability to store their luggage in the basement during non-apartment-stay hours.

---> The details of our check-in and check-out procedures are *automatically* emailed to confirmed guests by airbnb through our “House Manual”; the House Manual covers a variety of topics but we ask that you ****privilege what is written here**** regarding parking, plumbing, tidiness + cleanliness, and waste disposal (we are in the process of updating the House Manuals on all of our listings but sometimes our systems, etc. change this places is the quickest go-to place to relay/outline what we need our guests to know and/or do). 

IMPORTANT NOTES (parking, plumbing, tidiness + cleanliness, and waste disposal)*:

*Please privilege guest expectations and procedures written here over those received in the "House Manual”

**************PARKING**************:

We canNOT offer parking to most of our guests. We have 1 visitors parking pass for 6 units (maximum 3 days in a row in the zone indicated behind the pass (to be placed on the dashboard) & the vehicle must be moved every 24 hours); if you want the pass YOU MUST ASK us *****AND**** receive a message confirming that, indeed, you may use it (it is in high demand and often unavailable).

Due to the limited availability of parking in Cambridge (both through the house and in Cambridge overall), we suggest you not bring a car.

**************PLUMBING**************

While there are many fantastic and charming features of the old Victorian house, the old pipes are not one of them! Therefore:

YOU ***MUST*** USE THE HAIR AND FOOD CATCHERS IN ALL OF THE DRAINS. Indeed, WATER (/polarity bonded liquids (no oil)) IS THE ONLY THING THAT CAN GO DOWN THE SINKS AND TUB. Not doing so will clog up the pipes; if we need to call the plumber we may keep part, all of your security deposit to remedy the situation.

**************TIDINESS & CLEANLINESS of Your Living Space When Checking Out**************

There is a short window period between checking-in and checking-out and oftentimes we are booked back to back with multiple apartments to prepare. If your apartment takes more than about an hour to clean it is likely we will draw from your deposit for this extra service of your apartment requiring a deep cleaning after you check out. Crumbs and food all over the tables and counters (or food in the trash; see below under "Compost"!), spilled products on the bathroom sink, this is not what we expect to encounter to turn around the apartment to the next guest. The apartments are large and wiping all the surfaces down, cleaning the floors and changing the bedding and towels in the most basic way usually takes about an hour. In a way we're trying to clean invisible things (germs, finger prints, dust, etc.) form one guest to the next; when we clean and prepare apartments we do not expect to have to pick-up-after-you.

A my j**************WASTE DISPOSAL: COMPOSTING + RECYCLING + TRASH************** :

Our Earth is under seriously strained circumstances in terms of how much toxic matter humans are exposing it to, and as such, we take waste production seriously. The best sustainable practice mantra is (in this order): reduce, reuse, recycle.

GUESTS STAYING UNDER ONE WEEK:

Please leave your trash, recyclables and compost INSIDE of the apartment and KINDLY DO NOT take it outside. If you need to take it out for some reason, please see the “where" section for each type of waste.

GUESTS STAYING OVER ONE WEEK:

Take your trash, recyclables and compost to the 19 side of the house and put them IN THE PROPER BINS (if you are unable to do so for medical reasons, please let us know and we will gladly do this for you!). The trash and recycling is collected at around 7am Wednesday morning (one day later on weeks where there are national holidays);

********TRASH********

WHAT? anything that is NOT compostable (food) or recyclable (paper, glass, aluminum, plastic). Examples: styrofoam, dirt and hair (though these last 2 can put in the garden)….most (clean) materials can be recycled! :-)

WHERE? Indoors: in the bin marked “Trash.” Outdoors: in the BLACK OR GREY bins (these are smaller than the recycling bins).

HOW? In TIGHTLY SEALED PLASTIC BAGS. You CANNOT leave the bags unsealed (this disrespects the folks collecting the trash by risking waste falling out while disposing of it) and/or the City will reject the bin likely fine us (and we will have no qualms about passing this on to you (by withholding your security deposit).

********RECYCLING********

WHAT?

Paper (example: receipts, newspaper, tissues, cereal boxes)

Glass (for example:bottles),

Aluminum (for example:cans)

Hard Plastics (for example: your clean (see below) yoghurt containers, to-go food containers, etc.….*****You must KEEP SOFT PLASTICS (for example: plastic bags) SEPARATE from other recyclable materials*****; these clog the recycling sorting machine. We put these together outside (either in a small bin by the compost wheel and/or in a large bag full of soft plastics (mostly bags)!

** VERY IMPORTANT NOTE: all materials MUST BE CLEAN. This means that you have to rinse out you milk cartons, clean out containers containing food (put excess food in the compost (**NEVER down the sink drain**; see “Plumbing”).

WHERE?

Indoors: in the bin marked “Recycling.”

Outdoors: in the LARGE NAVY BLUE BINS (everything goes in there EXCEPT for your soft plastics (for example: plastic bags); put these in the small container by the compost wheel or in a large plastic bag full of soft plastics).

vHOW?

WI
********COMPOST********

I N sA Isis WHAT?

IAll of your food scraps (for example: fruits peels, tea bags, coffee grinds, vegetable scraps, etc.) EXCEPT for meat and dairy (egg shells are fine!). What do do with these food caught in the kitchen sink? Throw it in the zip lock bag in the freezer :)

name: Convenient! Charming! Cambridge!
summary: You can get there from here! Bike paths and parks nearby. Bus to Harvard at end of the block. Davis Square Red Line and access to heart of Boston a 7 minute walk . Quiet room for 2 with your own bath, deck for reading, living room for lounging, piano for playing, if you wish. PLEASE NOTE: Because you are in our home, we accept only guests who have previously received positive reviews on Airbnb. Thank you for abiding by this before you Instant book.
space: Stay in our quiet, convenient, Cambridge retreat instead of an expensive hotel. Private room and bath in Cambridge home near Davis and Porter Squares. Your bath adjoins your room. It is newly renovated, light and airy, with basic supplies included. Your bedroom is in the quiet back of the house, decorated in a soothing green with white shutters. You will have ample space in the closet and dresser to put your clothes, and a writing desk for your computer.The room is cool in the summer, even without air conditioning. We have free wi-fi, too! We do not serve breakfast, but you are welcome to coffee and to have a snack in the dining room or on our deck. Our bed and bath are  on another floor,and our den is clearly marked "private," so you have space to yourself, though we do share the kitchen and dining area. neighborhood_overview: We are a safe and diverse neighborhood. It's pretty quiet here, and there are several green spaces if you'd like to get exercise, yet we are near Davis Square with its excellent restaurants, frequent festivals, and bustling atmosphere. We are also near Hub bike stations if you want to explore Cambridge.
notes: We love having people from all over the world stay in our home. However, if you are booking with us, please book only for yourself. If you want to book for a third party, we need to be directly in contact with them before approving your stay.
transit: You are half a block from the bus which runs into Harvard Square and Arlington. You're a quick 7-8 minute walk from the Red Line which will connect you to all of the major subway/bus lines in Boston. You can take a cab/Lyft from the airport OR take the Silver Line to South Station and then take the Red Line to Davis Square and walk a few minutes. You can also take the Red Line from South Station to Harvard, hop on a #77 bus, and arrive about half a block from our home.
access: Bedroom, Bathroom ( not shared), Deck, Living Room, Kitchen for light breakfast, snacks ( not cooking), Dining Room, piano.
interaction: We'll be happy to talk with you about things to do, places to go. We both work full time, so let's arrange to talk.
house_rules: We love being able to share our home  with you. Since it is a home and not an hotel, here are some of the things  that we think will make your stay most pleasant: 1. No smoking 2. No pets. Our cat, King Simon, rules our house. 3. We are a shoeless house--please leave your shoes downstairs. 4. Only registered guests allowed. Please do not book for someone else. Only 2 people in the house at the same time, 5. You are welcome to eat something you have purchased, have a cup of coffee, or hang out in the dining room, kitchen, or deck, but we must ask that you take NO food into the bedroom. 6. We will do everything we can to accommodate your departure and arrival, but we must be there to greet you. Usually, this means check out before noon and check in after 3-4.  If you want a later checkout and no one is coming that evening, we can likely arrange it. host_about:
I am Italian, recently a retired biologist, and I have been living in Cambridge for half of my life. I worked at Harvard for 25 years, Japan, Italy, and my last research position was in Paris, France.
I speak Italian, Spanish, English and French. Some Portuguese in case of an emergency. I know Boston , Cambridge, and New England fairly well, to help, and guide you to places to visit.

name: Neat Room No 2 Cambridge
space: See the other post for details. In total, three rooms are available for rent.  My parents who live nearby take care of the condo for me. I recently moved to NYC. My parents do not speak English. But detailed instructions of the house will be provided in paper upon arrival. I am available by email and phone. I also love to host my guests in NYC.  The condo of 1200 square feet is recently renovated and elegantly furnished. The photos do not do justice to this sun-filled and well -organized condo. This No 2 bedroom is very spacious and nicely furnished with desk, queen size bed, nightstand, dresser, and closet. Clean towels, blanket, slippers, and clean sheets are available during checkin. One common bathroom and one adjacent living room. Wireless internet, big storage, spacious living room, eat in kitchen and parking on the street or designated spot. Big fridge to store food for you as well. The condo has a prime location, about two minutes walk to Alewife T station in Cambridge, Freshpo

host_about:
working professional living in New York. recently relocated to Singapore for one year maybe two Chinese-American. Enjoy traveling, reading books, classic music, cooking and sports. I am a world traveller, enjoy meeting people and making friends. I am very easy going, and open minded.... I am warm and hospitable. I treat my guests as friends, and I have built valuable and enriching friendships with a few of my guests in the past two years. It is priceless. 
I am a big fan of Airbnb. I open my home to welcome guests from all around the world. 
So I welcome you to Boston and New York. Hope our paths will cross some day.

name: Sunny flat on private lane, walk to MIT, Harvard
summary: Private 2nd floor apartment in a 19th century owner-occupied row house. The house is tucked away on a private lane minutes from Central Square, public transportation, restaurants, pubs, and a grocery store. MIT is a 12 min walk, or one subway stop in one direction, and Harvard is a 20 min walk, or one subway stop, in the other direction. The apartment gets lots of sun, and has a fully equipped eat-in kitchen, full bath, study, and large front room with a queen size bed. No TV, but good Wifi.

name: Bedroom in a Cambridge Condominium/Best Location
summary: My elegant Cambridge condo is the perfect hub.  I am located between Harvard and Porter Square, 2 minutes walk from the Red Line, 5 minutes walk from the Harvard Law School and just 10 minutes walk from Harvard Square.
space: One bedroom in a first-floor condo in an 1880's brick building about 10 minutes from the Harvard campus off Mass Ave. and Oxford Street on a quiet one-way street right in Porter Square 5 minutes from the Porter Square Redline stop.   This cozy bedroom (9 x 9 feet) with a full-sized sleigh bed, antique bureau and table has a closet and is directly adjacent to the bathroom.  Please note this room does not have a desk so if you are looking for a room with a workspace this may not be the listing for you. This is a gay-friendly household.

Guests are welcome to return at any time of night, however if you return past midnight, we ask you do so quietly and turn off all lights after entering. No overnight guests or entertaining.  Visits by a spouse or partner for long-term guests, or invitations to friends to one of our house parties or gatherings can be arranged by prior agreement. I do have a second bathroom downstairs through my teaching studio that you are welcome to use from Sunday-Friday mornings and after 9 weekdays. summary: The room includes a queen size Bed, Desk, chair, and Air conditioner. The apartment is a 3 bedroom 1 bath on the second and third floor of a 2 family house.     This listing is for one of the 2 rooms in the photos not both.
space: The Room includes a Bed, Desk, closet, remote over head dimming light and Air conditioner. The apartment is a 3 bedroom 1 bath on the second and third floor of a 2 family house. name: MIT/Harvard/Inman- 2 Bedroom Apt.
summary: First floor apartment located in our 2 family home. Located in vibrant and hip Inman Square. I live in a separate apartment upstairs with my husband and 2 children.  City of Cambridge Inspected and permitted  apartment.  Registration No. STR-14611
space: 2 bedroom Apartment on the first floor of a 2 unit home. Centrally located in vibrant Inman Square. 10-min walking distance to Harvard Sq, Central Square and the Red Line T. If you have a car we can provide a pass for on street parking in the area( please let me know ahead of time if you will be needing it).. This is a perfect location for visiting Harvard University, MIT or Boston.. 26 fabulous restaurants, cafes and coffee shops just around the corner or use the 2 groceries stores within a 10 minute walk. You also can have groceries delivered from Instacart from a number of local retailers. You can't go wrong in this area. Kitchen with full size appliances.  Toaster, coffee maker, utensils, dishes and basic cookware are provided. The larger bedroom has a queen size bed, desk and wardrobe. The 2nd smaller bedroom has a full size bed and small closet area. neighborhood_overview: What is not to love about Inman Square!! Tons of Restaurants and still maintaining a neighborhood feel.
notes: There is a queen size Aerobed that can be inflated for an additional sleeping surface in the rear bedroom closet. Extra sheets, blankets and pillow is in the front closet. If you use it please deflate it and put it back.
transit: Public transportation, HUBway bike rentals nearby, Lyft and UBER's are great car free options for your stay.
interaction: As often as needed or if we see each other in the hall I will say hello and ask about your stay and if you need anything. I live in the separate apartment upstairs.
house_rules: This is not a place for loud parties.   On the day of your departure you can put all the dirty towels in the tub and make sure the doors and all the windows are locked. Remove all your food from the refrigerator load and start the dishwasher with any dirty dishes. If you moved or rearranged furniture make an effort to put it back where you found it. if you leave for the day please turn the heat down to 64 degrees or turn the air conditioner in the window off. Please leave the apartment in similar condition as to where you found it.There is no smoking inside the house, on the patio, or the porches. .***** The Parking pass must be returned to the welcome basket  at the end of your stay, if it is not you loose your $250 security deposit, NO EXCEPTIONS!!**** Read all the signs on the street to make sure you are parking in an appropriate area to avoid being towed. check in is anytime after 4pm check out is 11am.

host_about:
i am a married stay at home mom to two amazing children and Airbnb host. I was the Chef/Owner of two award winning restaurants in Boston prior to having children. My husband Chad is a Engineer. 

 Cambridge has been our home for over 15 years and is an amazing place to live and raise a family.

name: Beautiful Light-Filled Bedroom/Best Location
summary: Come stay in one of the most elegant and centrally located condos in Cambridge. I am located between Harvard and Porter Square, 5 minutes walk from the Harvard Law School and just 10 minutes walk from Harvard Square.
space: This study holds an extremely comfortable sofa bed, a desk, and an antique dresser for your use, and looks out on an exclusive garden and patio.  The high end sofa bed is a Twilight Sleeper Sofa from Design Within Reach and expands into a twin size Single Bed: H 17" W 79" D 34.75".  The room is long and narrow, approximately 16.5 x 5.5 feet.  It's the perfect space for a visiting scholar or someone coming to visit Boston who wants to work and tour.  The room has three East and one South facing windows, and gets natural light the entire day.  The room and house are extremely quiet, surrounded by several old-growth shade trees on a one-way street with little traffic.  You will sleep extremely well here as our reviews attest, and I have had numerous professional writers and scholars come for a long stay to work. This is a gay-friendly household.

name: Quiet private room in N. Cambridge
summary: Quiet room w/ futon and couch, desk, and closet. Bus to Harvard Square leaves just around the corner. It's about a 10 to 14 minute ride depending on the time of day, and there is a subway connection there. There is also a subway stop about a 13 minute walk from my place. I have a lot of hosting experience and can provide good tips depending on an individual's interests.
space: Futon is comfortable, there are hangers in closet to hang up some clothes. Bathroom is just outside room in hallway.

neighborhood_overview: This was the working class neighborhood of Cambridge, the area where former speaker of the house, Tip O'Neil, grew up. A lot of condos have gone up in the neighborhood. It's an area that borders Arlington and Somerville, and Belmont and Watertown are also very close.
notes: If you are a bicyclist, a popular bike path called the Minuteman is just down the street.
transit: Bus to Harvard Square is just around the corner. The subway (Red Line) is about a 13 minute walk/

They would also have to work out a time with me about picking up the luggage as I would have to be home to let them in to retrieve it.

host_about: Worked in music industry for over 20 years. Passionate about music including music from many different areas of the world. I'm also an avid biker. Very helpful assisting travelers as I've hosted many from around the world. Enjoy meeting people and having conversations on a number of different topics. I've traveled extensively on a budget and am very resourceful helping others who may have a limited budget find things to do that they can afford.

name: Wonderful room by Harvard Square
summary: Quiet and lovely neighborhood close to the Charles River and Harvard Square. Cozy house, exquisitely decorated.
space: A quiet and pristine guest bedroom on the second floor of our very charming house. Private bathroom down the hall and small office adjacent to bedroom included. The house is a minute from the Charles River and a gorgeous 6 minute walk to Harvard Square (where there are restaurants, cafes, shops and....Harvard) and the subway.  Our house is on a very pretty and quiet residential street. The guest room has a full size bed with fine linens and a great mattress. The room looks out on one side over a fenced in garden (where you can have breakfast).  The small adjoining office has a small desk. Coffee, tea, fruit always available.

host_about:
Hi. I once had my palm read at a fair and I was told that I love to be at home and I love to travel. So true! That's why I love to stay in a place that I can make my home when I do travel.

I love good design, good food, small markets and shops, eating outside, preparing wonderful food.

name: Private room on quiet lane
summary: Small cottage on private lane 5 blocks from Central Square.  Two small rooms on second floor (total floor space 230 sq ft.). with 1/2 bath off bedroom and adjoining sitting room with futon couch. Full bath  and shared kitchen on first floor.  Host has en suite bedroom in basement.
space: Just 5 blocks from the Red Line but quiet except for noisy cardinals

host_about: I am a 73 year old retiree, have lived in this community for over 35 years and love to share it with guests.  My house is an old soap workers cottage built in the mid-nineteenth century which I have renovated over the years.  As noted guest bedroom with 1/2 bath as well as TV room are on the 2nd floor and guest full bathroom and shared kitchen are on the first floor. I have a studio in the basement and can be as available as you like but I respect your desire for privacy.  I have traveled extensively in France and am fluent in French.

name: Private room in Davis Sq. Cambridge
space: $ 75 per night $ 420 per week $ 1350 per month A comfy bedroom is available in a 3/1 apartment. Furnished with a queen size bed, book shelf, desk, etc. All utilities included. Free WiFi for one device. Free laundry in the basement. Linen and towels provided. Complimentary tea, coffee, and hot chocolate. Use of private backyard with lounge chairs, tables, BBQ pit. Public Transportation is convenient -- 8-10 minute walk to redline Davis T or Alewife T stops. The #77 bus into Harvard Square and #83 bus to Central Square are just a half block up the street. The rate is for one tenant only.  For extra guests, please e-mail for rate (winter slightly more expensive than summer). Positive identification required with photo taken and non-USA citizens must show valid US visa.

name: Minutes to Harvard Square
summary: This is a newly-updated well-maintained 2 bedroom condo in a classic Cambridgian three level triple decker house. We are located on the first floor (or 'ground floor' in European terms).  It is in the most quiet and safest neighborhood in Cambridge, 1.5 miles west of Harvard Square.
space: The prestine unit is located within 8 minutes of bus ride to Harvard Square (4 different MBTA buses pass the area with Apps to help with live tracking), in the Strawberry Hill district of Cambridge, MA. It is the safest neighborhood in Cambridge, very quiet yet very accessible to H. Sq or downtown.  There is also free street parking just in front of the condo, which is very rare for Cambridge.  One bedroom has a queen size bed and cabinet. The smaller bedroom has a full size sofa bed.  The living room is equipped with HD TV, Wifi, Wireless Speaker, fans, and a sofa bed as well.  The kitchen is brand new with all the necessary equipment.  The bathroom is brand new and marble floored. A shower head and glass sliding doors.

name: Victorian Charm MIT/Harvard/Kendall/Central-1BR
summary: Welcome to our 100-year-old house! Cozy, friendly and full of charm. Our location is hard to beat: close to both subway and bus with many excellent restaurants in walking distance. We are well-situated for conferences and functions at MIT or Harvard. Located in Central Square, we are an easy walk to Kendall and Inman Squares. For runners and walkers, the Charles River paths are 0.5 mile away. This unit features hardwood floors and nine foot ceilings. The private back deck is very popular.
space: This rental is effectively a studio apartment with a private, locked entrance on the middle floor in a 3-unit building. It consists of a private bedroom, private eat-in kitchen and full bathroom in Central Square. In nice weather, guests love to hangout on the private back porch surrounded by mature maple trees. It's great for morning coffee or that late afternoon glass of wine. If we are a central location for you to visit friends here, the driveway will accommodate your guests. The bedroom is extremely convertible. The beds can be set for two friends to have separate beds. For couples, we can set up as a king size bed. If you are three, the third person can take our very comfortable memory foam rollaway bed. This has proven highly satisfactory for guests ranging from college guys to grandmothers. In addition, if otherwise unoccupied, there is another bedroom down the hall with a single bed (and trundle). (Please see the Guest Access section for more info.) We have options, and we're
description: Welcome to our 100-year-old house! Cozy, friendly and full of charm. Our location is hard to beat: close to both subway and bus with many excellent restaurants in walking distance. We are well-situated for conferences and functions at MIT or Harvard. Located in Central Square, we are an easy walk to Kendall and Inman Squares. For runners and walkers, the Charles River paths are 0.5 mile away. This unit features hardwood floors and nine foot ceilings. The private back deck is very popular. This rental is effectively a studio apartment with a private, locked entrance on the middle floor in a 3-unit building. It consists of a private bedroom, private eat-in kitchen and full bathroom in Central Square. In nice weather, guests love to hangout on the private back porch surrounded by mature maple trees. It's great for morning coffee or that late afternoon glass of wine. If we are a central location for you to visit friends here, the driveway will accommodate your guests. The bedroom is extrem
neighborhood_overview: Despite our urban setting, our neighborhood is very quiet, particularly at bedtime. It has always been the kind of neighborhood where women can walk alone safely at night. We actively recycle. We can do it for you if you simply keep glass, plastic and metal trash together and separated from trash. We also keep a compost container in the fridge for vegetable trash. We'll empty it into the big bin outside when you leave.
notes: Please note check-in is 3pm though we are very happy to take bags early. Check-out is noon, and again, we're happy to store bags if you have later flights. We have several restaurant recommendations, plus a few warnings of places not to go. There are four grocery stores in walking distance.
transit: The subway, locally known as the "T", is a 7-8 minute walk away. The bus is a 5-6 minute walk. The river is about a 0.75 mile (1.1km) walk from our house. A nice walk/run path is there.
access: There is a second rental bedroom down the hall if you need extra space, just let us know. Three will fit comfortably in the main flat. Though better for one, the small bedroom will accommodate two friendly people with the trundle bed pulled out. There is an additional charge to use the extra bedroom.
interaction: You have a private, locked entrance. We're happy to share suggestions about our favorite restaurants and shops nearby, but we will be largely out of your way. Please don't hesitate to let us know anything you might need during your stay.
house_rules: We have only the usual expectations from respectful, responsible adults. We live one floor upstairs. And, please, NO nailing things into windows or walls. This really happened.

host_about:
We are a pair of classical musicians in Cambridge, located between MIT & Harvard. As with much of Cambridge, we're hopeless lefties. 

On parle un peu de français. Hablamos poco español. Und ein bisschen Deutsch auch.

Most Sundays you'll find us "making a joyful noise" at one church or another.
We've been in this old house and this neighborhood over 20 years now. Since we cook a bit, the rental floor fridge and pantry might contain a little overflow from ours. We're huge fans of Airbnb both as guests and as hosts. Leave your towels and sheets at home; we provide all that for you. Our biggest challenge as Airbnb hosts is saying goodbye to the awesome people who stay with us.

name: Lovely Room Near Porter & Harvard
summary: This is a large room in a nice house that is 3 blocks from Porter Square and 10 blocks from Harvard Square.
space: We have 3 sunny, spacious rooms in the heart of Cambridge. Very close to the subway, stores, restaurants, Harvard University, MIT, and Boston. Only a 5 minute walk to the subway (Redline), and a 15 minute train ride to downtown Boston. One subway stop away from Harvard Square. The rooms are located on the 2nd and 3rd floors of our house. They are all a good size. They feature all hardwood floors, big windows and lots of light. Each has a big bed, desk and dresser and a fridge, microwave and toaster oven (if necessary). There are two shared full baths. Free laundry and Wi-Fi! Note: There is no living room access and very limited kitchen access. If you are super clean and clean up after every meal, then there can be full kitchen access.  Other people in the house are my parents and other guests who are typically affiliated with Harvard or MIT. The bathroom is shared with two other tenants. It is in a very nice residential area with many parks close by. It is about 3 blocks away from Port

name: Room in 3/1 Apt Davis Sq. Cambridge
summary: This private room rental with its own private entrance is rented on a MONTHLY basis.  Days rented beyond a month with be prorated at a nightly rate of $43 per day.  A discount will be provided for guests staying longer than 2 months.
space: $ 75 per night $ 420 per week $1350 per month A comfy bedroom is available in a 3/1 apartment. Furnished with a twin size bed, book shelf, desk, etc. Private Entrance into the room from the outside. All utilities included. Free WiFi for one device. Free laundry in the basement. name: Cambridge Apt, walk to MIT, Harvard
summary: Private, sunny, top floor and a half of owner-occupied 19th century row house. The house is tucked away on a private lane minutes from Central Square and public transportation (subway and bus), restaurants, pubs, and two grocery stores. MIT is a 12-min walk, or one subway stop in one direction, and Harvard is a 20-min walk, or one subway stop, in the other direction. The flat gets lots of sun, and has a fully equipped eat-in kitchen and full bath.  No TV, but good Wifi.
space: The apartment has an open plan with wood floors throughout and exposed brick walls. There is a queen size bed and daybed in the loft, and a sofa that can be opened into a bed in the main living space. It should be noted that the loft is open, so there is little privacy within the flat itself. Also, the spiral staircase leading to the sleeping loft is narrow, and not easy to negotiate with luggage. The flat is on the top of the house, so be prepared for many stairs, but a great leafy view.

name: Harvard/MIT: Convenience & Luxury!
summary: We are steps from the red line subway in the middle of vibrant Central Square. This is the perfect place to be based to explore Harvard, MIT, Kendall Square and Boston. Anyone who loves cafes and restaurants will love this location! There are 2 public parks, 3 grocery stores, 6 coffee shops and more than 15 restaurants all within a 5 minute walk!  Walk 15 minutes and be at either Harvard or MIT.  You'll love our beautiful space in one of Boston's most beautiful and exciting neighborhoods.
space: This sun filled flat is the ideal Cambridge location. We are a 1 minute walk from the Central Square stop of the Red Line MBTA train.  Steps away from some of the best restaurants and bars in the Boston area - you can't beat this location!  Harvard is a 15 minute walk West and MIT is a 10 minute walk East.  Nestled in the heart of Cambridge with easy access to Boston (2 stops on the Red Line train), you will surely enjoy your stay.  The beautiful esplanade of the Charles River is an enjoyable 10 minute walk to the South.  The flat boasts modern stainless steel appliances in the immaculate eat-in kitchen.  There is a washer/dryer that is free for guests to use.  The whole unit was remodeled in 2005 and consists of a kitchen, living room, 3 bedrooms with queen beds (one with desk) and a rear porch. We provide a television with access to Netflix, HBO Go!, Amazon Instant Video and Hulu.
description: We are steps from the red line subway in the middle of vibrant Central Square. This is the perfect place to be based to explore Harvard, MIT, Kendall Square and Boston. Anyone who loves cafes and restaurants will love this location! There are 2 public parks, 3 grocery stores, 6 coffee shops and more than 15 restaurants all within a 5 minute walk!  Walk 15 minutes and be at either Harvard or MIT.  You'll love our beautiful space in one of Boston's most beautiful and exciting neighborhoods. This sun filled flat is the ideal Cambridge location. We are a 1 minute walk from the Central Square stop of the Red Line MBTA train.  Steps away from some of the best restaurants and bars in the Boston area - you can't beat this location!  Harvard is a 15 minute walk West and MIT is a 10 minute walk East.  Nestled in the heart of Cambridge with easy access to Boston (2 stops on the Red Line train), you will surely enjoy your stay.  The beautiful esplanade of the Charles River is an enjoyable 10 minut
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is one of the most exciting in all of Boston and Cambridge. We recommend checking out the places listed below. They are all less than a 5 minute walk away. Restaurants: Clover ($, literally just across the street – great café) Little Donkey ($$, amazing small plates, just opened, celebrity chefs) Life Alive ($, my favorite – such good vegetarian food) Oleana ($$, incredible Mediterranean food) Craigie on Main ($$$, one of Boston’s best restaurants) Café Luna ($, best brunch in Boston) Central Kitchen ($$, great American food) Thelonius Monkfish ($, pan-Asian with great sushi and live jazz) Mariposa Bakery ($, amazing sandwiches on home-made bread) Naco Taco ($, really fun and hip taco place with nice outdoor seating) …and so many more! Ice-cream: Toscanini's (best ice-cream in Boston?) Christina’s (second best ice-cream in Boston?) Music: Middle East Corner (free live music) Middle East Downstairs (larger music venue with covers between $10-20) Middle East Upstairs (mo
notes: There are three bedrooms, each with a queen bed. There is street parking by permit (we have a guest permit for you). Finding a spot within a block is usually easy. There is a public parking garage less than a block away for a second car or if covered parking is desired. Our apartment is located on the 2nd floor - there is one flight of stairs.
transit: We are a 1 minute walk from the red line subway  and the 1, 47, and 70 bus lines.  Also 1 minute away is the city bike share which provides bicycle access to commuters and tourists.  Parking is available on the street with Cambridge parking permit which we can provide to guests. Reaching our home from the airport is FREE: Take the silver line shuttle from the airport to south station where you transfer to the red line inbound towards Alewife.  Get off at the Central Square stop.  You are now a 1 minute walk away!
access: Wifi, rear porch (BBQ, al fresco dining), kitchen, bathroom, Keurig coffee maker, guest parking pass (sometimes a previous guest forgets to return the pass - this has only happened once but if it is missing then you can find garage parking less than a block away)
interaction: I'm always available to answer questions or solve any problems during your stay.
house_rules: We treat our guests with respect and hope that they treat us and our home with respect as well. We ask that guests let us know their planned arrival time so that we can be here to welcome them.  We don't allow pets or smoking indoors (the rear porch is fine).  No events or parties are allowed. Please be respectful of the neighbors and keep noise levels down after 10pm. We will assess a $300 fee for violation of these rules. Please note that booking requests from guests with Massachusetts-based profiles are accepted only under specific situations. Please send a booking request for consideration.

host_about: I am a PhD student at Harvard University studying bioengineering. I'm originally from San Francisco and travel between Cambridge and California all the time.  When I'm not thinking up experiments or writing I am traveling or reading.  I am a big fan of Hemingway and Fitzgerald.

name: Harvard or MIT walk 2 bedroom 2 baths
summary: Beautiful sunlit condominium.  Stainless kitchen. 2 bathrooms, 2 bedrooms.  Space for 6.  1st bdrm organic King bed.  2nd bdrm, brand new Full bed.  Living rm Ikea futon bed.  Prime Location.  Walk to Harvard & MIT campus and Downtown Boston.  Welcome!
space: Our new condo is a lovely 10 min stroll down cobblestone streets to Harvard Campus and Harvard Square, as well as one mile from MIT/Kendall Square and 10 min from Lesley University.  We are in Inman Square which boasts International Cuisine at Zagat rated restaurants such as Dali, and Oleana, coffee shops, bakeries and live music.  Join us in our Ivy League neighborhood with ease, there is easy street parking out front, and a secure entry to the building.  With two bathrooms and two bedrooms there is space for everyone to relax, and a premium kitchen for cooking with ingredients from Whole Foods next door to us, or Savenor's, Julia Child's favorite gourmet grocery, down the street.  As Kundalini yoga and meditation practitioners, we hope you will feel a sense of cleanliness and positive vibrations in our space.  We have a 5 year old son and 3 year old daughter, so we happily welcome children into our house.  If you want to venture into downtown Boston, you can hop on the bus that runs

neighborhood_overview: Harvard Square and Harvard Campus is a 10 minute walk away!  Kendall Sq and MIT Campus is a 10 min walk the other way! Here are some Restaurant notes I wrote to a guest the other day: Seafood:   Just down the street from us is East Coast Grill.  Delicious, Zagat rated.   I took some friends to Neptune Oyster in the North End, and they were in heaven.  It is expensive, but very high quality seafood.  Legal Harborside in the Seaport District is fun.     Italian: Strega in the Seaport is beautiful and near the water.  I love eating there.  It's next door to the ICA (institute for contemporary art) and on a boardwalk along the water that is fun to walk, you could lunch there and then walk the boardwalk over to the North End for dinner, or reverse!   Nearby, is Posto, in Davis Square, mostly Neopolitan style woodfired pizza and handmade pasta.   In case you like brunch: The Neighborhood Restaurant (You have to try the Cream of Wheat!!! )  This one is a lovely 10 min walk into Union Square.
notes: We have a Visitor parking spot in a covered parking lot behind our building, and an overnight Visitor Parking pass for free street parking.  Both are available for your use, so you may bring up to two cars here.
transit: Everything is walking distance.  Subway station is in Harvard Square or Central Square, 10 minute walk to each one.  Harvard Square and Central Sq. stations are on the Red Line, directly into Boston and Boston Common (Park Street Station).  Uber/Lyft are a simple, easy way to get downtown fast, 5 minutes drive from our location.  A new Whole Foods is one block away.
access: Stocked kitchen and Whole Foods next door for home cooking.   Washer and dryer.  Elevator makes getting suitcases in and out a breeze.  Easy guest parking.  Hip neighborhood where folks walk and ride bicycles.  Lovely Perry Park or Cambridge Public Library nearby for picnics.  Cambridge Hospital a block away for safety!
interaction: We love our Somerville/Cambridge location and are active in community and local government.  We can recommend a great local massage or coffee or meal based on your budget and group dynamic.  We are happy to be accessible during your stay for any questions about transportation or local highlights.   If you want to know about child friendly restaurants and activities in the area, we can give you the entire breakdown from library singalongs, toy stores and great parks for whatever age your child is.  We can even recommend trusted local babysitters.
house_rules: 1. Non-smokers only and no pets.  2. Please maintain a respectful noise level, especially in the elevator/hallway because it is not as soundproof as inside the condo.   3. Please take your shoes off and leave them in the entryway closet. 4. If you use the dishes, please wash them. Basic rule of thumb is to leave the condo in the condition that you found it. I'll take care of the linens and trash. :) No smoking Not suitable for pets No parties or events Check-in is after 5PM House rules: Guests agree to the following terms and conditions 1.  Guest(s) agree to NO PARTIES anywhere on the property. Legal action will be taken for parties that cause damages to the unit, property, reputation, or relationship with building staff or other residents.  2.  Smoking of any kind is not permitted in the unit or on the premises.  3.  Guests agree to abide by maximum occupancy of unit, and observe quiet hours between 9pm and 9am 4.  Guests are responsible for action of ALL GUESTS occupying their unit a

host_about: Hi, we are the Cordova family, Lumina, Rene and our two children.  Our son is 6 years old and our daughter is 4.  Lumina was born in Los Angeles.  Rene was born in Peru, his mother is Peruvian and father is Cuban.  His family moved to Miami when Rene was 15.  Rene works from home as an accounting software consultant and Lumina is a Kundalini Yoga and Radiant Child Yoga teacher.  We love walking around the neighborhood, spending time outside and practicing new recipes for family dinners.  AirBnB gives us a great excuse to get out of the house, visit family, explore new places, as well as have funds for international adventures.  In 2013 Airbnb funded our trip to Machu Picchu.

name: Duplex, Charles River, Harvard #
space: A tastefully decorated two-bedroom duplex, with two full bathrooms, kitchen/dining area, and living room; a 19th-Century New England home, fully equipped with modern services and appliances. The apartment has ample space for two couples, a family, or a couple looking for space and tranquility a few blocks from Harvard square and a ten minute bus ride to Boston. Situated on a quiet street just two blocks from the intersection of Mt. Auburn Street/Massachusetts Avenue and Putnam Streets, my home is ideal for relaxing and reading, yet only a few blocks from restaurants and cafes in the center of Cambridge. The neighborhood has the charm of new England: tree lined streets; a  very popular and lively bakery/cafe where locals and students mingle is only 50 meters from my house.  A few blocks away in another direction one can enjoy one of the most coveted parks along the Charles River with stunning views, ideal for sunbathing, running, reading or just sleeping under a tree. host_about:
I am Italian, recently a retired biologist, and I have been living in Cambridge for half of my life. I worked at Harvard for 25 years, Japan, Italy, and my last research position was in Paris, France.
I speak Italian, Spanish, English and French. Some Portuguese in case of an emergency. I know Boston , Cambridge, and New England fairly well, to help, and guide you to places to visit.

name: Huron Village Lower Unit Harvard Sq
summary: Beautifully decorated and newly renovated apartment in the heart of Huron Village - less than a mile away from Harvard Square. Colorful and light filled open floor plan with two private bedrooms. This is the lower unit in a two unit home.
space: Our gorgeous brand newly renovated and decorated Philly-Style apartment is available for short or medium term rentals. Perfect for visiting professors and parents visiting their children at Harvard or any of the other area colleges or universities.  Also great for business travelers who want a more spacious work space than a cramped suite at nearby hotel may give them or small families or groups of friends who are tourists in Cambridge/Boston area. There are two bedrooms  - one on each floor and one bath. Beautifully decorated with family antiques and new modern furniture. Lots of original and unique art is hung across the walls.  Marimekko (which is across the street) fabrics and pillows are strewn around each room. The apartment is alive with color and puts you in a good mood just looking around. The kitchen has a island with 3 stools and the dining room table seats 8 making it a great space for entertaining.  There are two regular queen sized beds - one in each bedroom and two self

Marimekko (which is across the street) fabrics and pillows are strewn around each room. The apartment is alive with color
neighborhood_overview: Huron Village is the greatest neighborhood in Cambridge (okay - we're bias). Conveniently located between Harvard Square and Fresh Pond our home is at the center of it all. The house sits at the intersection of Mobilia Gallery, Marimekko, and the Cambridge Trust Bank. The Fresh Pond Market is just across the street for all your grocery needs including beer and wine. If you don't feel like cooking then cross the street to Full Moon a European-American bistro or the Village Kitchen which has great pizza and italian fare. Just up the street is Formaggio's Kitchen a gourmand's paradise offer the best cheese selection in the world!  There are a dozen more funky independent shops around for clothing, furniture, books and more. Huron Village is bustling by day and quiet at night. Currently there is some construction going on the street/neighborhood which may start around 7 am  and can be a bit noisy some weekdays.
notes: This is not a bed and breakfast but for a extra fee we can make sure there are special provision upon arrival. Also there is a small grocery store across the street but it is not opened late nor on Sundays. There is more not itemized here - feel free to ask if you require something special.
transit: The bus stop (72) is right out the front door making it easy to get to Harvard Square and beyond in just minutes. You can walk to Harvard Square in just 10-15 minutes too.  Street parking is available and a visitor permit can be arranged with a few days notice.
access: Sheets, towels, basic paper products. Place settings for 4 and  cabinets and enough pots and pans to get by. Basic paper products are also provide.
interaction: We arrange to have guests checked in and out.
house_rules: No smoking is really our only rule & please treat our home as well as you would your own.

host_about:
I am Democratic political consultant who travels a lot for business and pleasure both domestically and internationally. My homes are showcases for the various art and handicrafts I have picked up along the way.

I have homes in Kigali, Rwanda, Washington, DC and in Cambridge, MA that  I list on AIRBNB and try to use AIRBNB when I travel as well. 

My brother Adam manages the Cambridge house most of the time and will be your primary contact should you choose to stay there.

name: Long term, Green, Modern Entire Condo MIT/MGH
summary: Entire Condo for long term rental with 2 bed, a sun-filled study, open layout modern kitchen & cozy living with fireplace close to MIT, Kendall, and MGH. Central H/A (unlike most in area) means no radiators and true AC! *We love to help families traveling for medical treatment.*
space: We are looking for a long-term rental.  Please contact us for details. This listing is for the *entire* apartment including all bills, gas, utilities, satellite tv, internet, plus all essentials and hospitality products you might need!  The condo is modern, which means we have central heat and air conditioning (unlike most apartments in Cambridge--crucial in the summer months, and nice instead of radiators in the winter months), a dishwasher, garbage disposal, convection oven, huge new hot water heater, modern refrigerator with filtered water and ice dispenser, a working gas fireplace, and an open kitchen and living room with lots of counter space. The house is going green!  Conversion to led lights (yes, even the cool Edison style lights are led!), energy star appliances and doors, and double pane modern windows.  We use natural cleaners as much as possible and organic detergent from Costco. :)  bamboo covered made in America memory foam pillows and mattress in the master completes th

neighborhood_overview: We're in the awesome area of Cambridge, near up-n-coming Kendall. Very close to MIT (5 min walk), the redline T (12 min walk), and buses that take you directly to the T stop just a block over (2 min walk). Also just a block or two to some of the best pubs and restaurants in the Boston area!!! Lord Hobo (voted best beer in Boston), Tatte (a celebrated pastry bakery and coffee), Emma's Pizza, Cambridge Brewing Company (voted best brew pub in America), Dunkin Donuts (New England tradition), and Friendly Toast (best breakfast/brunch in Boston) are all within just a block or so! At the same time we are in a very quiet, nice, and safe neighborhood with peaceful outdoor areas.
notes: We will request a liability release form/lease which is sent along with all the fun house information, getting around, and your wi-fi and key code around a week prior to your arrival. :)
transit: Very close to MIT (5 min walk), the redline T (12 min walk to kendall), and buses that take you directly to Kendall are just a block over (2 min walk).  There are also buses that go directly to Harvard one block away.  Last, for the bikers, there is a HubWay bicycle rental about a block.
access: You have the entire condo, and this includes access to the attached basement with free laundry.
house_rules: We will tolerate no smoking in the house or premise.  Pets are not allowed to keep out allergens for other guests.

name: Renovated Brownstone - MIT/Kendall
summary: City living at its finest! Comfortable private room and bath with new Queen size bed in recently renovated brownstone in East Cambridge.  LOCATION, LOCATION! Near MIT, MGH, Charles River and the many places of interest in Boston and Cambridge.
space: ACCOMMODATIONS:  Your private bedroom features:  - New super comfortable Queen-Size bed  - Room features a rocking chair, two bureaus and closet space  - Private bathroom with towels and toiletries  - Other amenities: hair dryer, iron and ironing board and Wi-Fi. In the summer my guests can enjoy coffee in the private patio and year round in my large modern kitchen.  Guests have access to a lovely living room with fireplace and TV with many cable stations. I love to greet my guests when they arrive when possible. If not, I leave a lock box on the door with instructions for easy access. I am usually close by  so we always connect at some point. I am located in East Cambridge - near Kendall Square, MIT, Harvard, Massachusetts General Hospital, and Boston - with easy access to everything Boston and Cambridge have to offer. The Museum of Science, the Galeria Mall, and the Charles River are a short 3-5 block walk and there are plenty of shops and restaurants nearby.
notes: I love to cook, entertain and meet new people. I share my home with my Bichon, Skipper.  He loves to meet new people, too. Looking forward to hearing from you!
transit: PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION:  Accessible by the Lechmere (Green Line) subway “T" Stop (5 minute walk) and the Kendall Square (Red line) “T" stop (12 minute walk). The Red line connects at South Station with the Silver Line airport Shuttle. The entire trip from airport to my house by public transportation is around 45 minutes. The 69 bus is 2 blocks away and it conveniently loops from Cambridge Street, near my house, to Harvard square. Cambridge has a HUB bike rental system located at the Lechmere and Kendall T stops. You can rent bikes using a credit or debit card and use the bikes for a day or more for very reasonable rates. You can return the bikes to the same place or to anywhere there is a center.
access: In the summer my guests can enjoy coffee in the private patio and year round in my large modern kitchen.  Guests have access to a lovely living room with fireplace and TV with many cable stations.
interaction: I love to greet my guests when they arrive when possible. If not, I leave a lock box on the door with instructions for easy access. I am usually close by  so we always connect at some point.
house_rules: 1. Communication is key! Let me know if you have any questions and I will be sure to help.  2. Please, no smoking in my home.  3. Please, no visitors without prior approval. 4. Please be respectful of my home, my belongings and the neighbors. 5. Please don't feed my dog, Skipper; he has a  special diet that doesn't include human food! 6. Have fun and enjoy!

host_about:
A little bit about me…

Originally from Florida, I found my way to New England via Spain where I lived and worked for 10 years! I have resided in Cambridge for the past 13 years and love everything it has to offer. I know the city well and can give you tips on things to do, places to see, and where to eat! 

I am a Spanish teacher and I love every opportunity to meet new, interesting people from other places. I love to travel, cook, and spend time with friends and family.  I share my renovated Brownstone with a well-behaved Bichon, Skipper, who also likes to meet new people.

Hope you will plan to visit, I would love to host you.
